Chapter I]340-the middle ages part one chapter i [The Bertolini]8-the bertolini

“ [The Signora]2174-the signora had no business to do it , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , “ no business at all . [She]2174-the signora promised [us]2175-us [south rooms with a view close together]2176-south rooms with a view close together , instead of which [here]2177-here are [north rooms]2178-north rooms , looking into [a courtyard]2179-a courtyard , and a long way apart . Oh , [Lucy]129-lucy ! ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ And a Cockney , besides ! ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , who had been further saddened by the [Signora]136-signora bertolini ’s unexpected accent . “ It might be [London]9-london . ”[129-lucy] [She]129-lucy looked at the two rows of [English people who were sitting at the table]341-english people who were sitting at the table ; at the row of white bottles of water and red bottles of wine that ran between [the English people]342-the english people ; at the portraits of [the late Queen]343-the late queen and the late Poet Laureate that hung behind [the English people]342-the english people , heavily framed ; at the notice of [the English church]345-the english church ( [Rev. Cuthbert Eager]137-rev. cuthbert eager , [M. A. Oxon]346-m. a. oxon . ) , that was the only other decoration of the wall . “ [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett , do n’t [you]128-miss bartlett feel , too , that [we]2180-we might be in [London]9-london ? [I]129-lucy can hardly believe that all kinds of other things are just outside . [I]129-lucy suppose it is one ’s being so tired . ”[129-lucy]

“ This meat has surely been used for soup , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , laying down [her]128-miss bartlett fork .

“ [I]129-lucy want so to see [the Arno]10-the arno . [The rooms the Signora promised [us]2180-we]2181-the rooms the signora promised us in [her]129-lucy letter would have looked over [the Arno]10-the arno . [The Signora]136-signora bertolini had no business to do it at all . Oh , it is a shame ! ”[129-lucy]

“ Any nook does for [me]128-miss bartlett , ”[128-miss bartlett] [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett continued ; “ but it does seem hard that [you]129-lucy should n’t have a view . ”[128-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]129-lucy felt that [she]129-lucy had been selfish . “ [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett , [you]128-miss bartlett must n’t spoil [me]129-lucy : of course , [you]128-miss bartlett must look over [the Arno]10-the arno , too . [I]129-lucy meant that . [The first vacant room in the front]2182-the first vacant room in the front — ”[129-lucy] “ [You]129-lucy must have it , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , part of whose travelling expenses were paid by [[Lucy]129-lucy ’s mother]347-lucy ’s mother — a piece of generosity to which [she]128-miss bartlett made many a tactful allusion .

“ No , no . [You]129-lucy must have it . ”[129-lucy]

“ [I]128-miss bartlett insist on it . [[Your]129-lucy mother]2183-your mother would never forgive [me]128-miss bartlett , [Lucy]129-lucy . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [She]2183-your mother would never forgive [me]129-lucy . ”[129-lucy]

[The ladies]348-the ladies ’ voices grew animated , and — if the sad truth be owned — a little peevish . [They]348-the ladies were tired , and under the guise of unselfishness [they]348-the ladies wrangled . [Some of [[their]348-the ladies neighbours]350-their neighbours]349-some of their neighbours interchanged glances , and [one of [them]349-some of their neighbours]351-one of them — [one of [the ill - bred people whom one does meet abroad]353-the ill - bred people whom one does meet abroad]352-one of the ill - bred people whom one does meet abroad — leant forward over the table and actually intruded into [their]348-the ladies argument . [He]351-one of them said :

“ [I]351-one of them have a view , [I]351-one of them have a view . ”[351-one of them]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett was startled . Generally at a pension [people]354-people looked [them]355-them over for a day or two before speaking , and often did not find out that [they]354-people would “ do ”[356-the intruder] till [they]354-people had gone . [She]128-miss bartlett knew that [the intruder]356-the intruder was ill - bred , even before [she]128-miss bartlett glanced at [him]356-the intruder . [He]356-the intruder was [an old man , of heavy build , with a fair , shaven face and large eyes]357-an old man , of heavy build , with a fair , shaven face and large eyes . There was something childish in those eyes , though it was not the childishness of senility . What exactly it was [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett did not stop to consider , for [her]128-miss bartlett glance passed on to [his]356-the intruder clothes . These did not attract [her]128-miss bartlett . [He]356-the intruder was probably trying to become acquainted with [them]358-them before [they]358-them got into [the swim]359-the swim . So [she]128-miss bartlett assumed a dazed expression when [he]356-the intruder spoke to [her]128-miss bartlett , and then said : “ A view ? Oh , a view ! How delightful a view is ! ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ This is [[my]360-the old man son]2184-my son , ”[360-the old man] said [the old man]360-the old man ; “ [his]2184-my son name ’s [George]126-george . [He]2184-my son has a view too . ”[360-the old man]

“ Ah , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , repressing [Lucy]129-lucy , who was about to speak .

“ What [I]356-the intruder mean , ”[356-the intruder] [he]356-the intruder continued , “ is that [you]129-lucy can have [[our]2185-we rooms]2186-our rooms , and [we]2185-we ’ll have [yours]129-lucy . [We]2185-we ’ll change . ”[356-the intruder]

[The better class of tourist]361-the better class of tourist was shocked at this , and sympathized with [the new - comers]362-the new - comers . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , in reply , opened [her]128-miss bartlett mouth as little as possible , and said “ Thank [you]360-the old man very much indeed ; that is out of the question . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Why ? ”[360-the old man] said [the old man]360-the old man , with both fists on the table .

“ Because it is quite out of the question , thank [you]129-lucy . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [You]360-the old man see , [we]2185-we do n’t like to take — ”[129-lucy] began [Lucy]129-lucy . [[Her]129-lucy cousin]364-her cousin again repressed [her]129-lucy .

“ But why ? ”[356-the intruder] [he]356-the intruder persisted . “ [Women]2187-women like looking at a view ; [men]2188-men do n’t . ”[356-the intruder] And [he]356-the intruder thumped with [his]356-the intruder fists like [a naughty child]365-a naughty child , and turned to [[his]356-the intruder son]366-his son , saying , “ [George]126-george , persuade [them]348-the ladies ! ”[356-the intruder]

“ It ’s so obvious [they]348-the ladies should have [the rooms]2189-the rooms , ”[367-the son] said [the son]367-the son . “ There ’s nothing else to say . ”[367-the son]

[He]356-the intruder did not look at [the ladies]348-the ladies as [he]356-the intruder spoke , but [his]356-the intruder voice was perplexed and sorrowful . [Lucy]129-lucy , too , was perplexed ; but [she]129-lucy saw that [they]348-the ladies were in for what is known as “ quite a scene , ”[129-lucy] and [she]129-lucy had an odd feeling that whenever [these ill - bred tourists]369-these ill - bred tourists spoke the contest widened and deepened till it dealt , not with [rooms]370-rooms and views , but with — well , with something quite different , whose existence [she]129-lucy had not realized before . Now [the old man]360-the old man attacked [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett almost violently : Why should [she]128-miss bartlett not change ? What possible objection had [she]128-miss bartlett ? [They]348-the ladies would clear out in half an hour .

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , though skilled in the delicacies of conversation , was powerless in the presence of brutality . It was impossible to snub any one so gross . [Her]128-miss bartlett face reddened with displeasure . [She]128-miss bartlett looked around as much as to say , “ Are [you]360-the old man all like this ? ”[128-miss bartlett] And [two little old ladies , who were sitting further up the table , with shawls hanging over the backs of the chairs]372-two little old ladies , who were sitting further up the table , with shawls hanging over the backs of the chairs , looked back , clearly indicating “ [We]372-two little old ladies , who were sitting further up the table , with shawls hanging over the backs of the chairs are not ; [we]372-two little old ladies , who were sitting further up the table , with shawls hanging over the backs of the chairs are genteel . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Eat [your]129-lucy dinner , [dear]2190-dear , ”[128-miss bartlett] [she]128-miss bartlett said to [Lucy]129-lucy , and began to toy again with the meat that [she]128-miss bartlett had once censured .

[Lucy]129-lucy mumbled that those seemed very odd people opposite .

“ Eat [your]129-lucy dinner , [dear]2190-dear . This pension is a failure . To - morrow [we]372-two little old ladies , who were sitting further up the table , with shawls hanging over the backs of the chairs will make a change . ”[128-miss bartlett]

Hardly had [she]129-lucy announced this fell decision when [she]129-lucy reversed it . The curtains at the end of [the room]373-the room parted , and revealed [a clergyman , stout but attractive , who hurried forward to take [his]374-a clergyman , stout but attractive , who hurried forward to take his place at the table , cheerfully apologizing for his lateness place at the table , cheerfully apologizing for [his]374-a clergyman , stout but attractive , who hurried forward to take his place at the table , cheerfully apologizing for his lateness lateness]374-a clergyman , stout but attractive , who hurried forward to take his place at the table , cheerfully apologizing for his lateness . [Lucy]129-lucy , who had not yet acquired decency , at once rose to [her]129-lucy feet , exclaiming : “ Oh , oh ! Why , it ’s [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe ! Oh , how perfectly lovely ! Oh , [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett , [we]372-two little old ladies , who were sitting further up the table , with shawls hanging over the backs of the chairs must stop now , however bad [the rooms]2189-the rooms are . Oh ! ”[129-lucy]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett said , with more restraint :

“ How do [you]133-mr. beebe do , [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe ? [I]128-miss bartlett expect that [you]133-mr. beebe have forgotten [us]372-two little old ladies , who were sitting further up the table , with shawls hanging over the backs of the chairs : [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett and [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy , who were at [Tunbridge Wells]11-tunbridge wells when [you]133-mr. beebe helped [the Vicar of [St. Peter]12-st. peter]2193-the vicar of st. peter ’s that very cold Easter . ”[128-miss bartlett]

[The clergyman , who had the air of one on a holiday]375-the clergyman , who had the air of one on a holiday , did not remember [the ladies]348-the ladies quite as clearly as [they]348-the ladies remembered [him]375-the clergyman , who had the air of one on a holiday . But [he]375-the clergyman , who had the air of one on a holiday came forward pleasantly enough and accepted the chair into which [he]375-the clergyman , who had the air of one on a holiday was beckoned by [Lucy]129-lucy .

“ [I]377-the girl , who was in a state of spiritual starvation am so glad to see [you]375-the clergyman , who had the air of one on a holiday , ”[377-the girl , who was in a state of spiritual starvation] said [the girl , who was in a state of spiritual starvation]377-the girl , who was in a state of spiritual starvation , and would have been glad to see [the waiter]378-the waiter if [[her]377-the girl , who was in a state of spiritual starvation cousin]364-her cousin had permitted it . “ Just fancy how small [the world]333-the world is . [Summer Street]13-summer street , too , makes it so specially funny . ”[377-the girl , who was in a state of spiritual starvation]

“ [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy lives in [the parish of [Summer Street]13-summer street]2195-the parish of summer street , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , filling up the gap , “ and [she]129-lucy happened to tell [me]128-miss bartlett in the course of conversation that [you]375-the clergyman , who had the air of one on a holiday have just accepted the living — ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Yes , [I]377-the girl , who was in a state of spiritual starvation heard from [mother]2196-mother so last week . “ Quite right , ”[380-the clergyman] said [the clergyman]380-the clergyman . “ [I]380-the clergyman move into [the Rectory]2197-the rectory at [Summer Street]13-summer street next June . [I]380-the clergyman am lucky to be appointed to such [a charming neighbourhood]2198-a charming neighbourhood . ”[380-the clergyman]

“ Oh , how glad [I]128-miss bartlett am ! The name of [[our]2199-our house]2200-our house is [Windy Corner]14-windy corner . ”[128-miss bartlett] [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe bowed .

“ There is [mother]2196-mother and [me]128-miss bartlett generally , and [[my]128-miss bartlett brother]2202-my brother , though it ’s not often [we]2199-our get [him]2202-my brother to ch — — [The church]2203-the church is rather far off , [I]128-miss bartlett mean . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [Lucy]129-lucy , dearest , let [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe eat [his]133-mr. beebe dinner . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [I]133-mr. beebe am eating it , thank [you]128-miss bartlett , and enjoying it . ”[133-mr. beebe]

[He]133-mr. beebe preferred to talk to [Lucy]129-lucy , whose playing [he]133-mr. beebe remembered , rather than to [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , who probably remembered [his]133-mr. beebe sermons . [He]133-mr. beebe asked [the girl]381-the girl whether [she]381-the girl knew [Florence]22-florence well , and was informed at some length that [she]381-the girl had never been [there]382-there before . “ [That lady]2206-that lady looks so clever , ”[128-miss bartlett] whispered [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett to [[her]128-miss bartlett cousin]364-her cousin . “ [We]386-them are in luck . ”[128-miss bartlett]

And , indeed , a perfect torrent of information burst on [them]386-them . [The father]399-the father did not see it ; [the son]367-the son acknowledged it , not by another bow , but by raising [his]367-the son eyebrows and smiling ; [he]367-the son seemed to be smiling across something .

“ Oh , dear ! ”[422-the little old lady] breathed [the little old lady]422-the little old lady , and shuddered as if all the winds of heaven had entered [the apartment]442-the apartment . “ [Gentlemen]2260-gentlemen sometimes do not realize — ”[422-the little old lady] [Her]422-the little old lady voice faded away , but [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett seemed to understand and a conversation developed , in which [gentlemen who did not thoroughly realize]443-gentlemen who did not thoroughly realize played a principal part . For [she]129-lucy was determined to enjoy [herself]129-lucy on the morrow . Thus the half - hour crept profitably away , and at last [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett rose with a sigh , and said :

“ [I]128-miss bartlett think one might venture now . No , [Lucy]129-lucy , do not stir . [I]128-miss bartlett will superintend the move . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ No , [dear]2190-dear . ”[128-miss bartlett]

[Charlotte]128-miss bartlett ’s energy ! And [her]128-miss bartlett unselfishness ! [She]128-miss bartlett had been thus all [her]128-miss bartlett life , but really , on this Italian tour , [she]128-miss bartlett was surpassing [herself]128-miss bartlett . So [Lucy]129-lucy felt , or strove to feel . And yet — there was a rebellious spirit in [her]129-lucy which wondered whether the acceptance might not have been less delicate and more beautiful . “ [I]128-miss bartlett want to explain , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , “ why it is that [I]128-miss bartlett have taken [the largest room]2263-the largest room . [Lucy]129-lucy was bewildered .

[I]128-miss bartlett am [a woman of [the world]333-the world]2267-a woman of the world , in [my]128-miss bartlett small way , and [I]128-miss bartlett know where things lead to . “ [Mother]147-mother would n’t mind [I]129-lucy ’m sure , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , but again had the sense of larger and unsuspected issues .

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett only sighed , and enveloped [her]129-lucy in a protecting embrace as [she]128-miss bartlett wished [her]129-lucy good - night . It gave [Lucy]129-lucy the sensation of a fog , and when [she]129-lucy reached [[her]129-lucy own room]444-her own room [she]129-lucy opened the window and breathed the clean night air , thinking of [the kind old man who had enabled [her]129-lucy to see the lights dancing in [the Arno]10-the arno and the cypresses of [San Miniato]32-san miniato]446-the kind old man who had enabled her to see the lights dancing in the arno and the cypresses of san miniato , and [the foot - hills of [the Apennines]26-the apennines]447-the foot - hills of the apennines , black against the rising moon .

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , in [[her]128-miss bartlett room]448-her room , fastened the window - shutters and locked the door , and then made a tour of [the apartment]442-the apartment to see where the cupboards led , and whether there were any oubliettes or secret entrances . It was then that [she]128-miss bartlett saw , pinned up over the washstand , a sheet of paper on which was scrawled an enormous note of interrogation . Nothing more .

“ What does it mean ? ”[128-miss bartlett] [she]128-miss bartlett thought , and [she]128-miss bartlett examined it carefully by the light of a candle . Meaningless at first , it gradually became menacing , obnoxious , portentous with evil . [She]128-miss bartlett was seized with an impulse to destroy it , but fortunately remembered that [she]128-miss bartlett had no right to do so , since it must be the property of [young Mr. Emerson]126-george . So [she]128-miss bartlett unpinned it carefully , and put it between two pieces of blotting - paper to keep it clean for [him]126-george . Then [she]128-miss bartlett completed [her]128-miss bartlett inspection of [the room]373-the room , sighed heavily according to [her]128-miss bartlett habit , and went to bed .

Chapter II In [Santa Croce]27-santa croce with [No Baedeker]146-baedeker

It was pleasant to wake up in [Florence]22-florence , to open the eyes upon [a bright bare room]451-a bright bare room , with a floor of red tiles which look clean though they are not ; with a painted ceiling whereon pink griffins and blue [amorini sport in a forest of yellow violins and bassoons]452-amorini sport in a forest of yellow violins and bassoons . It was pleasant , too , to fling wide the windows , pinching the fingers in unfamiliar fastenings , to lean out into sunshine with beautiful hills and trees and [marble churches]453-marble churches opposite , and close below , [the Arno]10-the arno , gurgling against [the embankment of [the road]455-the road]454-the embankment of the road .

Over [the river]456-the river [men]2188-men were at work with spades and sieves on [the sandy foreshore]458-the sandy foreshore , and on [the river]456-the river was [a boat]460-a boat , also diligently employed for some mysterious end . [An electric tram]461-an electric tram came rushing underneath the window . [No one]2230-no one was inside [it]461-an electric tram , except [one tourist]463-one tourist ; but [its]461-an electric tram platforms were overflowing with [Italians , who preferred to stand]464-italians , who preferred to stand . [Children]465-children tried to hang on behind , and [the conductor]466-the conductor , with no malice , spat in [their]465-children faces to make [them]465-children let go . Then [soldiers]467-soldiers appeared — [good - looking , undersized men]468-good - looking , undersized men — wearing each a knapsack covered with mangy fur , and a great - coat which had been cut for [some larger soldier]469-some larger soldier . Beside [them]467-soldiers walked [officers]470-officers , looking foolish and fierce , and before [them]467-soldiers went [little boys , turning somersaults in time with the band]471-little boys , turning somersaults in time with the band . [The tramcar]472-the tramcar became entangled in [their]467-soldiers ranks , and moved on painfully , like a caterpillar in a swarm of ants . [One of [the little boys]474-the little boys]473-one of the little boys fell down , and some white bullocks came out of an archway . Indeed , if it had not been for the good advice of [an old man who was selling button - hooks]475-an old man who was selling button - hooks , [the road]455-the road might never have got clear .

Over such trivialities as these many a valuable hour may slip away , and [the traveller who has gone to [Italy]19-italy to study the tactile values of [Giotto]159-giotto , or the corruption of [the Papacy]29-the papacy]477-the traveller who has gone to italy to study the tactile values of giotto , or the corruption of the papacy , may return remembering nothing but the blue sky and the men and [women who live under it]478-women who live under it . So it was as well that [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett should tap and come in , and having commented on [Lucy]129-lucy ’s leaving the door unlocked , and on [her]129-lucy leaning out of the window before [she]129-lucy was fully dressed , should urge [her]129-lucy to hasten [herself]129-lucy , or the best of the day would be gone . By the time [Lucy]129-lucy was ready [[her]129-lucy cousin]364-her cousin had done [her]364-her cousin breakfast , and was listening to [the clever lady among the crumbs]480-the clever lady among the crumbs .

A conversation then ensued , on not unfamiliar lines . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett was , after all , a wee bit tired , and thought [they]481-they had better spend the morning settling in ; unless [Lucy]129-lucy would at all like to go out ? [Lucy]129-lucy would rather like to go out , as it was [her]129-lucy first day in [Florence]22-florence , but , of course , [she]129-lucy could go alone . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett could not allow this . Of course [she]128-miss bartlett would accompany [Lucy]129-lucy everywhere . Oh , certainly not ; [Lucy]129-lucy would stop with [[her]129-lucy cousin]364-her cousin . Oh , no ! that would never do . Oh , yes !

At this point [the clever lady]392-the clever lady broke in .

“ If it is [Mrs. Grundy]148-mrs. grundy who is troubling [you]129-lucy , [I]392-the clever lady do assure [you]129-lucy that [you]129-lucy can neglect [the good person]2270-the good person . Being English , [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy will be perfectly safe . [Italians]149-italians understand . [A dear friend of [mine]392-the clever lady]2271-a dear friend of mine , [Contessa Baroncelli]150-contessa baroncelli , has [two daughters]2272-two daughters , and when [she]150-contessa baroncelli can not send [a maid]2273-a maid to school with [them]2272-two daughters , [she]150-contessa baroncelli lets [them]2272-two daughters go in sailor - hats instead . [Every one]2274-every one takes [them]2272-two daughters for English , [you]129-lucy see , especially if [their]2272-two daughters hair is strained tightly behind . ”[392-the clever lady]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett was unconvinced by the safety of [[Contessa Baroncelli]150-contessa baroncelli ’s daughters]484-contessa baroncelli ’s daughters . [She]128-miss bartlett was determined to take [Lucy]129-lucy [herself]129-lucy , [her]129-lucy head not being so very bad . “ [I]392-the clever lady will take [you]129-lucy by [a dear dirty back way]2275-a dear dirty back way , [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy , and if [you]129-lucy bring [me]392-the clever lady luck , [we]2276-we shall have an adventure . ”[392-the clever lady]

[Lucy]129-lucy said that this was most kind , and at once opened the Baedeker , to see where [Santa Croce]27-santa croce was .

“ Tut , tut ! [Miss Lucy]129-lucy ! [I]392-the clever lady hope [we]2276-we shall soon emancipate [you]129-lucy from [Baedeker]146-baedeker . [He]2277-he does but touch the surface of things . This sounded very interesting , and [Lucy]129-lucy hurried over [her]129-lucy breakfast , and started with [[her]129-lucy new friend]486-her new friend in high spirits . [Italy]19-italy was coming at last . [The Cockney Signora]151-the cockney signora and [her]151-the cockney signora works had vanished like a bad dream .

[Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish — for that was [the clever lady]392-the clever lady ’s name — turned to the right along [the sunny Lung ’ Arno]488-the sunny lung ’ arno . How delightfully warm ! [The men on [the river]456-the river]491-the men on the river were fishing . ( Untrue ; but then , so is most information . ) Then [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish darted under the archway of the white bullocks , and [she]127-miss lavish stopped , and [she]127-miss lavish cried :

So [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish proceeded through [the streets of [the city of]495-the city of [Florence]22-florence]494-the streets of the city of florence , short , fidgety , and playful as a kitten , though without a kitten ’s grace . “ [Buon giorno]153-buon giorno ! “ Oh , please — ! If [[my]129-lucy father]2255-my father was alive , [I]129-lucy am sure [he]2255-my father would vote [Radical]155-radical again now that [Ireland]34-ireland is all right . And as it is , the glass over [our]2282-us front door was broken last election , and [Freddy]135-freddy is sure it was [the Tories]2290-the tories ; but [mother]2196-mother says nonsense , [a tramp]2292-a tramp . ”[129-lucy]

“ Shameful ! [A manufacturing district]2293-a manufacturing district , [I]127-miss lavish suppose ? ”[127-miss lavish]

“ No — in [the Surrey hills]2294-the surrey hills . [About five miles from [Dorking]35-dorking]2295-about five miles from dorking , looking over [the Weald]36-the weald . ”[129-lucy]

[Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish seemed interested , and slackened [her]127-miss lavish trot .

“ What a delightful part ; [I]127-miss lavish know it so well . [It]2296-it is full of [the very nicest people]2297-the very nicest people . Do [you]127-miss lavish know [Sir Harry Otway]156-sir harry — [a Radical]2298-a radical if ever there was ? ”[127-miss lavish]

[Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish was not disgusted , and said it was just the size of [[[her]127-miss lavish aunt]500-her aunt ’s [Suffolk estate]502-suffolk estate]501-her aunt ’s suffolk estate . [Italy]19-italy receded . [They]503-they tried to remember the last name of [Lady Louisa]158-lady louisa someone , who had taken [a house near [Summer Street]13-summer street]504-a house near summer street the other year , but [she]158-lady louisa had not liked it , which was odd of [her]158-lady louisa . Certainly [they]503-they had seemed a long time in reaching [Santa Croce]27-santa croce , the tower of which had been plainly visible from the landing window . But [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish had said so much about knowing [her]127-miss lavish Florence by heart , that [Lucy]129-lucy had followed [her]127-miss lavish with no misgivings .

“ Lost ! lost ! [[My]127-miss lavish dear]2232-my dear [Miss Lucy]129-lucy , during [our]503-they political diatribes [we]503-they have taken a wrong turning . [Two lone females in [an unknown town]2306-an unknown town]2305-two lone females in an unknown town . Now , this is what [I]127-miss lavish call an adventure . ”[127-miss lavish]

[Lucy]129-lucy , who wanted to see [Santa Croce]27-santa croce , suggested , as a possible solution , that [they]503-they should ask the way there .

“ Oh , but that is the word of [a craven]2307-a craven ! And no , [you]129-lucy are not , not , not to look at [[your]129-lucy Baedeker]2308-your baedeker . Give it to [me]129-lucy ; [I]129-lucy sha n’t let [you]129-lucy carry it . [We]503-they will simply drift . ”[129-lucy]

Accordingly [they]503-they drifted through a series of [those grey - brown streets]505-those grey - brown streets , neither commodious nor picturesque , in which [the eastern quarter of [the city]507-the city]506-the eastern quarter of the city abounds . [Lucy]129-lucy soon lost interest in the discontent of [Lady Louisa]158-lady louisa , and became discontented [herself]129-lucy . For one ravishing moment [Italy]19-italy appeared . [She]129-lucy stood in [the Square of [the Annunziata]38-the annunziata]508-the square of the annunziata and saw in [the living terra - cotta]509-the living terra - cotta [those divine babies whom no cheap reproduction]510-those divine babies whom no cheap reproduction can ever stale . There [they]503-they stood , with [their]503-they shining limbs bursting from the garments of charity , and [their]503-they strong white arms extended against circlets of heaven . [Lucy]129-lucy thought [she]129-lucy had never seen anything more beautiful ; but [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish , with a shriek of dismay , dragged [her]129-lucy forward , declaring that [they]503-they were out of [their]503-they path now by at least a mile .

The hour was approaching at which the continental breakfast begins , or rather ceases , to tell , and [the ladies]348-the ladies bought some hot chestnut paste out of [a little shop]512-a little shop , because it looked so typical . It tasted partly of the paper in which it was wrapped , partly of hair oil , partly of the great unknown . But it gave [them]348-the ladies strength to drift into another [Piazza]41-the piazza , large and dusty , on the farther side of which rose a black - and - white façade of surpassing ugliness . [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish spoke to it dramatically . It was [Santa Croce]27-santa croce . The adventure was over .

“ Stop a minute ; let [those two people]2309-those two people go on , or [I]127-miss lavish shall have to speak to [them]2309-those two people . “ Look at [their]2309-those two people figures ! ”[127-miss lavish] laughed [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish . “ [They]2309-those two people walk through [[my]127-miss lavish [Italy]19-italy]2313-my italy like a pair of cows . And in a moment [she]127-miss lavish was away over [the Piazza]516-the piazza , [her]127-miss lavish military cloak flapping in the wind ; nor did [she]127-miss lavish slacken speed till [she]127-miss lavish caught up [an old man with white whiskers]517-an old man with white whiskers , and nipped [him]517-an old man with white whiskers playfully upon the arm .

[Lucy]129-lucy waited for nearly ten minutes . Then [she]129-lucy began to get tired . [The beggars]389-the beggars worried [her]129-lucy , the dust blew in [her]129-lucy eyes , and [she]129-lucy remembered that [a young girl]425-a young girl ought not to loiter in public places . [She]129-lucy descended slowly into [the Piazza]41-the piazza with the intention of rejoining [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish , who was really almost too original . But at that moment [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish and [her]127-miss lavish local - colour box moved also , and disappeared down [a side street]520-a side street , both gesticulating largely . Tears of indignation came to [Lucy]129-lucy ’s eyes partly because [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish had jilted [her]129-lucy , partly because [she]127-miss lavish had taken [her]127-miss lavish Baedeker . How could [she]129-lucy find [her]129-lucy way [home]428-home ? How could [she]129-lucy find [her]129-lucy way about in [Santa Croce]27-santa croce ? [Her]129-lucy first morning was ruined , and [she]129-lucy might never be in [Florence]22-florence again . A few minutes ago [she]129-lucy had been all high spirits , talking as [a woman of culture]522-a woman of culture , and half persuading [herself]129-lucy that [she]129-lucy was full of originality . Now [she]129-lucy entered [the church]2203-the church depressed and humiliated , not even able to remember whether [it]2203-the church was built by [the Franciscans]524-the franciscans or [the Dominicans]525-the dominicans . Of course , [it]2203-the church must be [a wonderful building]526-a wonderful building . But how like [a barn]527-a barn ! And how very cold ! Of course , [it]2203-the church contained frescoes by [Giotto]159-giotto , in the presence of whose tactile values [she]129-lucy was capable of feeling what was proper . But who was to tell [her]129-lucy which [they]528-they were ? [She]129-lucy walked about disdainfully , unwilling to be enthusiastic over monuments of uncertain authorship or date . There was [no one]2230-no one even to tell [her]129-lucy which , of all the sepulchral slabs that paved [the nave]530-the nave and transepts , was the one that was really beautiful , the one that had been most praised by [Mr. Ruskin]160-mr. ruskin .

Then the pernicious charm of [Italy]19-italy worked on [her]129-lucy , and , instead of acquiring information , [she]129-lucy began to be happy . [She]129-lucy puzzled out the Italian notices — the notices that forbade [people]354-people to introduce dogs into [the church]2203-the church — the notice that prayed [people]354-people , in the interest of health and out of respect to [the sacred edifice in which [they]354-people found [themselves]354-people]534-the sacred edifice in which they found themselves , not to spit . [She]129-lucy watched [the tourists]535-the tourists ; [their]535-the tourists noses were as red as [[their]535-the tourists Baedekers]536-their baedekers , so cold was [Santa Croce]27-santa croce . [She]129-lucy beheld the horrible fate that overtook [three Papists]537-three papists — [two he - babies]538-two he - babies and [a she - baby]539-a she - baby — who began [their]537-three papists career by sousing each other with the Holy Water , and then proceeded to [the Machiavelli memorial]540-the machiavelli memorial , dripping but hallowed . Advancing towards [it]540-the machiavelli memorial very slowly and from immense distances , [they]537-three papists touched the stone with [their]537-three papists fingers , with [their]537-three papists handkerchiefs , with [their]537-three papists heads , and then retreated . What could this mean ? [They]537-three papists did it again and again . Then [Lucy]129-lucy realized that [they]537-three papists had mistaken [Machiavelli]162-machiavelli for [some saint]541-some saint , hoping to acquire virtue . Punishment followed quickly . [The smallest he - baby]542-the smallest he - baby stumbled over one of the sepulchral slabs so much admired by [Mr. Ruskin]160-mr. ruskin , and entangled [his]542-the smallest he - baby feet in the features of [a recumbent bishop]543-a recumbent bishop . [Protestant]163-protestant as [she]129-lucy was , [Lucy]129-lucy darted forward . [She]129-lucy was too late . [He]542-the smallest he - baby fell heavily upon [the prelate]544-the prelate ’s upturned toes .

“ [Hateful bishop]2316-hateful bishop ! ”[126-george] exclaimed the voice of [old Mr. Emerson]126-george , who had darted forward also . “ Hard in life , hard in death . Go out into the sunshine , [little boy]2317-little boy , and kiss [your]2317-little boy hand to the sun , for that is where [you]2317-little boy ought to be . [The child]545-the child screamed frantically at these words , and at [these dreadful people who picked [him]545-the child up , dusted [him]545-the child , rubbed [his]545-the child bruises]546-these dreadful people who picked him up , dusted him , rubbed his bruises , and told [him]545-the child not to be superstitious .

“ Look at [him]545-the child ! ”[126-george] said [Mr. Emerson]126-george to [Lucy]129-lucy . “ [Here]2177-here ’s a mess : [a baby hurt , cold , and frightened]2320-a baby hurt , cold , and frightened ! But what else can [you]129-lucy expect from [a church]2321-a church ? ”[126-george]

[The child]545-the child ’s legs had become as melting wax . Each time that old [Mr. Emerson]126-george and [Lucy]129-lucy set it erect it collapsed with a roar . Fortunately [an Italian lady , who ought to have been saying [her]548-an italian lady , who ought to have been saying her prayers prayers]548-an italian lady , who ought to have been saying her prayers , came to the rescue . By some mysterious virtue , which [mothers]549-mothers alone possess , [she]548-an italian lady , who ought to have been saying her prayers stiffened [the little boy]550-the little boy ’s back - bone and imparted strength to [his]550-the little boy knees . [He]550-the little boy stood . Still gibbering with agitation , [he]550-the little boy walked away .

“ [You]129-lucy are [a clever woman]2322-a clever woman , ”[126-george] said [Mr. Emerson]126-george . “ [You]129-lucy have done more than all the relics in [the world]333-the world . [I]126-george am not of [your]129-lucy creed , but [I]126-george do believe in those who make [their]164-the emersons fellow - creatures happy . [He]126-george paused for a phrase .

“ Niente , ”[551-the italian lady] said [the Italian lady]551-the italian lady , and returned to [her]551-the italian lady prayers .

“ [I]129-lucy ’m not sure [she]551-the italian lady understands English , ”[129-lucy] suggested [Lucy]129-lucy .

In [her]129-lucy chastened mood [she]129-lucy no longer despised [the Emersons]164-the emersons . [She]129-lucy was determined to be gracious to [them]164-the emersons , beautiful rather than delicate , and , if possible , to erase [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett ’s civility by some gracious reference to [the pleasant rooms]552-the pleasant rooms .

“ [That woman]2325-that woman understands everything , ”[126-george] was [Mr. Emerson]126-george ’s reply . “ But what are [you]2325-that woman doing [here]2177-here ? Are [you]2325-that woman doing [the church]2203-the church ? Are [you]2325-that woman through with [the church]2203-the church ? ”[126-george]

“ No , ”[129-lucy] cried [Lucy]129-lucy , remembering [her]129-lucy grievance . “ [I]129-lucy came here with [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish , who was to explain everything ; and just by the door — it is too bad!—she simply ran away , and after waiting quite a time , [I]129-lucy had to come in by [myself]129-lucy . ”[129-lucy]

“ Why should n’t [you]2325-that woman ? ”[126-george] said [Mr. Emerson]126-george .

“ Yes , why should n’t [you]2325-that woman come by [yourself]2325-that woman ? ”[367-the son] said [the son]367-the son , addressing [the young lady]554-the young lady for the first time .

“ But [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish has even taken away [Baedeker]146-baedeker . ”[129-lucy]

“ [Baedeker]146-baedeker ? ”[126-george] said [Mr. Emerson]126-george . “ [I]126-george ’m glad it ’s that [you]129-lucy minded . It ’s worth minding , the loss of [a Baedeker]146-baedeker . That ’s worth minding . ”[126-george]

[Lucy]129-lucy was puzzled . [She]129-lucy was again conscious of some new idea , and was not sure whither it would lead [her]129-lucy .

“ If [you]129-lucy ’ve no [Baedeker]146-baedeker , ”[367-the son] said [the son]367-the son , “ [you]129-lucy ’d better join [us]2329-us . ”[367-the son] Was this where the idea would lead ? [She]129-lucy took refuge in [her]129-lucy dignity .

“ Thank [you]129-lucy very much , but [I]129-lucy could not think of that . [I]129-lucy hope [you]129-lucy do not suppose that [I]129-lucy came to join on to [you]129-lucy . [I]129-lucy really came to help with [the child]545-the child , and to thank [you]129-lucy for so kindly giving [us]2329-us [[your]129-lucy rooms]2259-your rooms last night . [I]129-lucy hope that [you]129-lucy have not been put to any great inconvenience . ”[129-lucy]

“ [[My]360-the old man dear]2232-my dear , ”[360-the old man] said [the old man]360-the old man gently , “ [I]360-the old man think that [you]2232-my dear are repeating what [you]2232-my dear have heard [older people]2333-older people say . [You]2232-my dear are pretending to be touchy ; but [you]2232-my dear are not really . Stop being so tiresome , and tell [me]360-the old man instead what part of [the church]2203-the church [you]2232-my dear want to see . To take [you]2232-my dear to it will be a real pleasure . ”[360-the old man]

Now , this was abominably impertinent , and [she]557-she ought to have been furious . But it is sometimes as difficult to lose [one]424-one ’s temper as it is difficult at other times to keep it . [Lucy]129-lucy could not get cross . [Mr. Emerson]126-george was [an old man]559-an old man , and surely [a girl]560-a girl might humour [him]126-george . On the other hand , [[his]126-george son]366-his son was [a young man]562-a young man , and [she]557-she felt that [a girl]560-a girl ought to be offended with [him]126-george , or at all events be offended before [him]126-george . It was at [him]126-george that [she]557-she gazed before replying .

“ [I]557-she am not touchy , [I]557-she hope . It is the Giottos that [I]557-she want to see , if [you]566-the teacher will kindly tell [me]557-she which they are . ”[557-she]

[The son]367-the son nodded . With a look of sombre satisfaction , [he]126-george led the way to [the Peruzzi Chapel]565-the peruzzi chapel . There was a hint of [the teacher]566-the teacher about [him]126-george . [She]557-she felt like [a child in school who had answered a question rightly]567-a child in school who had answered a question rightly .

[The chapel]568-the chapel was already filled with [an earnest congregation]569-an earnest congregation , and out of [them]569-an earnest congregation rose the voice of [a lecturer]570-a lecturer , directing [them]569-an earnest congregation how to worship [Giotto]159-giotto , not by tactful valuations , but by the standards of the spirit .

“ Remember , ”[570-a lecturer] [he]570-a lecturer was saying , “ the facts about [this church of [Santa Croce]27-santa croce]2335-this church of santa croce ; how [it]2335-this church of santa croce was built by faith in the full fervour of medievalism , before any taint of the Renaissance had appeared . Observe how [Giotto]159-giotto in these frescoes — now , unhappily , ruined by restoration — is untroubled by the snares of anatomy and perspective . Could anything be more majestic , more pathetic , beautiful , true ? How little , [we]2336-we feel , avails knowledge and technical cleverness against [a man who truly feels]2337-a man who truly feels ! ”[570-a lecturer]

“ No ! ”[126-george] exclaimed [Mr. Emerson]126-george , in much too loud a voice for [church]571-church . “ Remember nothing of the sort ! Built by faith indeed ! That simply means [the workmen]2338-the workmen were n’t paid properly . And as for the frescoes , [I]126-george see no truth in them . Look at [that fat man in blue]2339-that fat man in blue ! [He]2339-that fat man in blue must weigh as much as [I]126-george do , and [he]2339-that fat man in blue is shooting into the sky like an air balloon . ”[126-george]

[He]570-a lecturer was referring to the fresco of the “ Ascension of [St. John]165-st. john . ”[570-a lecturer] Inside , [the lecturer]572-the lecturer ’s voice faltered , as well it might . [The audience]573-the audience shifted uneasily , and so did [Lucy]129-lucy . [She]129-lucy was sure that [she]129-lucy ought not to be with [these men]574-these men ; but [they]574-these men had cast a spell over [her]129-lucy . [They]574-these men were so serious and so strange that [she]129-lucy could not remember how to behave .

“ Now , did this happen , or did n’t it ? Yes or no ? ”[574-these men]

[George]126-george replied :

“ It happened like this , if it happened at all . [I]126-george would rather go up to [heaven]2340-heaven by [myself]126-george than be pushed by cherubs ; and if [I]126-george got [there]382-there [I]126-george should like [[my]126-george friends]2342-my friends to lean out of it , just as [they]2342-my friends do here . ”[126-george]

“ [You]126-george will never go up , ”[395-his father] said [[his]126-george father]395-his father . “ [You]126-george and [I]395-his father , [dear boy]2343-dear boy , will lie at peace in [the earth]2344-the earth that bore [us]2345-our , and [our]2345-our names will disappear as surely as [our]2345-our work survives . ”[395-his father]

“ [Some of the people]2346-some of the people can only see the empty grave , not [the saint]2347-the saint , whoever [he]2347-the saint is , going up . It did happen like that , if it happened at all . ”[395-his father]

[The lecturer]572-the lecturer was [a clergyman]2231-a clergyman , and [[his]572-the lecturer audience]578-his audience must be also [[his]572-the lecturer flock]579-his flock , for [they]578-his audience held prayer - books as well as guide - books in [their]578-his audience hands . [The procession]582-the procession disappeared without a word .

Soon [the lecturer]572-the lecturer could be heard in [the next chapel]584-the next chapel , describing the life of [St. Francis]168-st. francis .

“ [George]126-george , [I]572-the lecturer do believe [that clergyman]2351-that clergyman is [the Brixton curate]2352-the brixton curate . ”[572-the lecturer]

[George]126-george went into [the next chapel]584-the next chapel and returned , saying “ Perhaps [he]2351-that clergyman is . [I]126-george do n’t remember . ”[126-george]

“ Then [I]572-the lecturer had better speak to [him]2351-that clergyman and remind [him]2351-that clergyman who [I]572-the lecturer am . It ’s that [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager . Why did [he]2351-that clergyman go ? Did [we]2353-we talk too loud ? How vexatious . [I]572-the lecturer shall go and say [we]2353-we are sorry . Had n’t [I]572-the lecturer better ? Then perhaps [he]2351-that clergyman will come back . ”[572-the lecturer]

“ [He]2351-that clergyman will not come back , ”[126-george] said [George]126-george .

But [Mr. Emerson]126-george , contrite and unhappy , hurried away to apologize to [the Rev. Cuthbert Eager]137-rev. cuthbert eager . “ Because [we]2353-we think it improves [[our]2353-we characters]2356-our characters . “ How silly of [them]354-people ! ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , though in [her]129-lucy heart [she]129-lucy sympathized ; “ [I]129-lucy think that a kind action done tactfully — ”[129-lucy]

[He]588-the son , who took every little contretemps as if it were a tragedy threw up [his]588-the son , who took every little contretemps as if it were a tragedy head in disdain . Apparently [she]129-lucy had given the wrong answer . [She]129-lucy watched [the singular creature]589-the singular creature pace up and down [the chapel]568-the chapel . For [a young man]562-a young man [his]562-a young man face was rugged , and — until the shadows fell upon it — hard . Enshadowed , it sprang into tenderness . [She]129-lucy saw [him]562-a young man once again at [Rome]43-rome , on the ceiling of [the Sistine Chapel]592-the sistine chapel , carrying a burden of acorns . Healthy and muscular , [he]562-a young man yet gave [her]129-lucy the feeling of greyness , of tragedy that might only find solution in the night . The feeling soon passed ; it was unlike [her]129-lucy to have entertained anything so subtle . Born of silence and of unknown emotion , it passed when [Mr. Emerson]126-george returned , and [she]129-lucy could re - enter the world of rapid talk , which was alone familiar to [her]129-lucy .

“ Were [you]129-lucy snubbed ? ”[366-his son] asked [[his]126-george son]366-his son tranquilly .

“ But [we]2358-we have spoilt the pleasure of [I]129-lucy do n’t know how many people . [They]2359-they wo n’t come back . ”[129-lucy]

“ ... full of innate sympathy ... quickness to perceive good in others ... vision of the brotherhood of [man]2360-man ... ”[129-lucy] Scraps of the lecture on [St. Francis]168-st. francis came floating round the partition wall .

“ Do n’t let [us]2358-we spoil [yours]129-lucy , ”[126-george] [he]126-george continued to [Lucy]129-lucy . “ Have [you]129-lucy looked at [those saints]2361-those saints ? ”[126-george]

[He]126-george did not know , and suggested that [they]594-they should try to guess it . But [Mr. Emerson]126-george was only half interested . “ [I]605-i like [Giotto]159-giotto , ”[605-i] [she]605-i replied . “ It is so wonderful what [they]2363-they say about [his]126-george tactile values . Though [I]605-i like things like [the Della Robbia babies]2364-the della robbia babies better . ”[605-i]

“ So [you]605-i ought . [A baby]2365-a baby is worth [a dozen saints]2366-a dozen saints . And [[my]126-george baby]2367-my baby ’s worth [the whole of [Paradise]45-paradise]2368-the whole of paradise , and as far as [I]126-george can see [he]2367-my baby lives in [Hell]46-hell . ”[126-george]

[Lucy]129-lucy again felt that this did not do .

“ Oh , [dear]2190-dear ! ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy .

And think how [he]2367-my baby has been brought up — free from all the superstition and ignorance that lead [men]2188-men to hate [one another]2371-one another in the name of [God]170-god . With such an education as that , [I]605-i thought [he]2367-my baby was bound to grow up happy . ”[605-i]

[She]129-lucy was no theologian , but [she]129-lucy felt that here was [a very foolish old man]606-a very foolish old man , as well as [a very irreligious one]607-a very irreligious one . [She]129-lucy also felt that [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother might not like [her]129-lucy talking to [that kind of person]609-that kind of person , and that [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett would object most strongly .

“ What are [we]2372-we to do with [him]2367-my baby ? ”[606-a very foolish old man] [he]606-a very foolish old man asked . “ [He]2367-my baby comes out for [his]2367-my baby holiday to [Italy]19-italy , and behaves — like that ; like [the little child who ought to have been playing]2373-the little child who ought to have been playing , and who hurt [himself]2367-my baby upon the tombstone . Eh ? What did [you]129-lucy say ? ”[606-a very foolish old man]

[Lucy]129-lucy had made no suggestion . Suddenly [he]606-a very foolish old man said :

“ Now do n’t be stupid over this . [I]606-a very foolish old man do n’t require [you]129-lucy to fall in love with [[my]606-a very foolish old man boy]2374-my boy , but [I]606-a very foolish old man do think [you]129-lucy might try and understand [him]2367-my baby . [You]129-lucy are nearer [his]2367-my baby age , and if [you]129-lucy let [yourself]129-lucy go [I]606-a very foolish old man am sure [you]129-lucy are sensible . [You]129-lucy might help [me]606-a very foolish old man . [He]2367-my baby has known [so few women]2375-so few women , and [you]129-lucy have the time . [You]129-lucy stop here several weeks , [I]606-a very foolish old man suppose ? But let [yourself]129-lucy go . [You]129-lucy are inclined to get muddled , if [I]606-a very foolish old man may judge from last night . Let [yourself]129-lucy go . Pull out from the depths those thoughts that [you]129-lucy do not understand , and spread them out in the sunlight and know the meaning of them . By understanding [George]126-george [you]129-lucy may learn to understand [yourself]129-lucy . It will be good for both of [you]129-lucy . ”[606-a very foolish old man]

To this extraordinary speech [Lucy]129-lucy found no answer .

“ [I]610-he only know what it is that ’s wrong with [him]126-george ; not why it is . ”[610-he]

“ And what is it ? ”[129-lucy] asked [Lucy]129-lucy fearfully , expecting some harrowing tale .

“ The old trouble ; things wo n’t fit . ”[610-he]

“ What things ? ”[610-he]

“ The things of [the universe]2324-the universe . It is quite true . [They]2377-they do n’t . ”[610-he]

“ Oh , [Mr. Emerson]126-george , whatever do [you]126-george mean ? ”[610-he]

In [his]610-he ordinary voice , so that [she]129-lucy scarcely realized [he]610-he was quoting poetry , [he]610-he said :

“ ‘ From far , from eve and morning , And yon twelve - winded sky , The stuff of life to knit [me]610-he Blew hither : here am [I]610-he ’[610-he]

[George]126-george and [I]0-i both know this , but why does it distress [him]610-he ? [We]611-we know that [we]611-we come from the winds , and that [we]611-we shall return to [them]612-them ; that all life is perhaps a knot , a tangle , a blemish in the eternal smoothness . But why should this make [us]611-we unhappy ? Let [us]611-we rather love [one another]2371-one another , and work and rejoice . [I]0-i do n’t believe in [this world]614-this world sorrow . ”[0-i]

[Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy assented .

“ Then make [[my]129-lucy boy]2374-my boy think like [us]611-we . Make [him]610-he realize that by the side of the everlasting Why there is a Yes — a transitory Yes if [you]2379-you like , but a Yes . ”[129-lucy]

Suddenly [she]129-lucy laughed ; surely [one]424-one ought to laugh . [A young man]562-a young man melancholy because [the universe]2324-the universe would n’t fit , because life was a tangle or a wind , or a Yes , or something !

“ [I]129-lucy ’m very sorry , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy cried . “ [You]2379-you ’ll think [me]129-lucy unfeeling , but — but — ”[129-lucy] Then [she]129-lucy became matronly . “ Oh , but [[your]2379-you son]2380-your son wants employment . Has [he]610-he no particular hobby ? Why , [I]129-lucy [myself]129-lucy have worries , but [I]129-lucy can generally forget them at the piano ; and collecting stamps did no end of good for [[my]129-lucy brother]2202-my brother . Perhaps [Italy]19-italy bores [him]610-he ; [you]129-lucy ought to try [the Alps]2382-the alps or [the Lakes]2383-the lakes . ”[129-lucy]

[The old man]360-the old man ’s face saddened , and [he]360-the old man touched [her]129-lucy gently with [his]360-the old man hand . This did not alarm [her]129-lucy ; [she]129-lucy thought that [her]129-lucy advice had impressed [him]360-the old man and that [he]360-the old man was thanking [her]129-lucy for it . Indeed , [he]360-the old man no longer alarmed [her]129-lucy at all ; [she]129-lucy regarded [him]360-the old man as a kind thing , but quite silly . [Her]129-lucy feelings were as inflated spiritually as they had been an hour ago esthetically , before [she]129-lucy lost [Baedeker]146-baedeker . [The dear George]619-the dear george , now striding towards [them]620-them over the tombstones , seemed both pitiable and absurd . [He]360-the old man approached , [his]360-the old man face in the shadow . [He]360-the old man said :

“ [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett . ”[360-the old man]

“ Oh , good gracious [me]129-lucy ! ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , suddenly collapsing and again seeing the whole of life in a new perspective . “ Where ? Where ? ”[129-lucy]

“ In [the nave]530-the nave . ”[360-the old man]

“ [I]129-lucy see . Those gossiping [little Miss Alans]171-the miss alans must have — ”[129-lucy] [She]129-lucy checked [herself]129-lucy .

“ [Poor girl]2385-poor girl ! ”[171-the miss alans] exploded [Mr. Emerson]171-the miss alans . “ [Poor girl]2385-poor girl ! ”[171-the miss alans]

[She]129-lucy could not let this pass , for it was just what [she]129-lucy was feeling [herself]129-lucy .

“ [Poor girl]2385-poor girl ? [I]129-lucy fail to understand the point of that remark . [I]129-lucy think [myself]129-lucy [a very fortunate girl]2388-a very fortunate girl , [I]129-lucy assure [you]2389-you . [I]129-lucy ’m thoroughly happy , and having a splendid time . Pray do n’t waste time mourning over [me]129-lucy . There ’s enough sorrow in [the world]333-the world , is n’t [there]382-there , without trying to invent it . Good - bye . Thank [you]2389-you both so much for all [your]2389-you kindness . Ah , yes ! there does come [[my]129-lucy cousin]2244-my cousin . A delightful morning ! [Santa Croce]27-santa croce is [a wonderful church]2393-a wonderful church . ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy joined [[her]129-lucy cousin]364-her cousin .

Chapter III Music , [Violets]123-violets , and the Letter “ S ”[129-lucy]

It so happened that [Lucy]129-lucy , who found daily life rather chaotic , entered a more solid world when [she]129-lucy opened the piano . [She]129-lucy was then no longer either deferential or patronizing ; no longer either [a rebel]622-a rebel or [a slave]623-a slave . The kingdom of music is not [the kingdom of [this world]614-this world]624-the kingdom of this world ; it will accept [those whom breeding and intellect and culture have alike rejected]626-those whom breeding and intellect and culture have alike rejected . [The commonplace person]627-the commonplace person begins to play , and shoots into the empyrean without effort , whilst [we]628-we look up , marvelling how [he]627-the commonplace person has escaped [us]628-we , and thinking how [we]628-we could worship [him]627-the commonplace person and love [him]627-the commonplace person , would [he]627-the commonplace person but translate [his]627-the commonplace person visions into human words , and [his]627-the commonplace person experiences into human actions . Perhaps [he]627-the commonplace person can not ; certainly [he]627-the commonplace person does not , or does so very seldom . [Lucy]129-lucy had done so never .

[She]129-lucy was [no dazzling exécutante]629-no dazzling exécutante ; [her]129-lucy runs were not at all like strings of pearls , and [she]129-lucy struck no more right notes than was suitable for one of [her]129-lucy age and situation . Nor was [she]129-lucy [the passionate young lady]630-the passionate young lady , who performs so tragically on a summer ’s evening with the window open . Passion was there , but it could not be easily labelled ; it slipped between love and hatred and jealousy , and all the furniture of the pictorial style . And [she]129-lucy was tragical only in the sense that [she]129-lucy was great , for [she]129-lucy loved to play on the side of Victory . Victory of what and over what — that is more than the words of daily life can tell [us]628-we . But that some sonatas of [Beethoven]172-beethoven are written tragic [no one]2230-no one can gainsay ; yet [they]632-they can triumph or despair as [the player]633-the player decides , and [Lucy]129-lucy had decided that [they]632-they should triumph .

A very wet afternoon at [the Bertolini]8-the bertolini permitted [her]129-lucy to do the thing [she]129-lucy really liked , and after lunch [she]129-lucy opened the little draped piano . [A few people]634-a few people lingered round and praised [her]129-lucy playing , but finding that [she]129-lucy made no reply , dispersed to [[their]634-a few people rooms]2253-their rooms to write up [their]634-a few people diaries or to sleep . [She]129-lucy took no notice of [Mr. Emerson]171-the miss alans looking for [[his]171-the miss alans son]366-his son , nor of [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett looking for [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish , nor of [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish looking for [her]127-miss lavish cigarette - case . Like [every true performer]637-every true performer , [she]129-lucy was intoxicated by the mere feel of the notes : they were fingers caressing [her]129-lucy own ; and by touch , not by sound alone , did [she]129-lucy come to [her]129-lucy desire .

[Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , sitting unnoticed in the window , pondered this illogical element in [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy , and recalled the occasion at [Tunbridge Wells]11-tunbridge wells when [he]133-mr. beebe had discovered it . It was at one of those entertainments where [the upper classes]638-the upper classes entertain [the lower]639-the lower . The seats were filled with [a respectful audience]640-a respectful audience , and [the ladies and gentlemen of the parish]641-the ladies and gentlemen of the parish , under the auspices of [[their]641-the ladies and gentlemen of the parish vicar]642-their vicar , sang , or recited , or imitated the drawing of a champagne cork . Among the promised items was “ [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy . Piano . Beethoven , ”[133-mr. beebe] and [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe was wondering whether it would be [Adelaida]173-adelaida , or the march of [The Ruins of [Athens]48-athens]47-the ruins of athens , when [his]133-mr. beebe composure was disturbed by the opening bars of Opus III . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe rather felt that [they]164-the emersons had gone under . [He]133-mr. beebe wondered whether [he]133-mr. beebe would not plan a pleasant day for [these folk]697-these folk before [they]164-the emersons left — some expedition , perhaps , with [Lucy]129-lucy well chaperoned to be nice to [them]164-the emersons . It was one of [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe ’s chief pleasures to provide [people]354-people with happy memories .

Evening approached while [they]164-the emersons chatted ; the air became brighter ; the colours on the trees and [hills]699-hills were purified , and [the Arno]10-the arno lost its muddy solidity and began to twinkle . There were a few streaks of bluish - green among the clouds , a few patches of watery light upon [the earth]2344-the earth , and then the dripping façade of [San Miniato]32-san miniato shone brilliantly in the declining sun .

“ Too late to go out , ”[167-miss alan] said [Miss Alan]167-miss alan in a voice of relief . “ [All the galleries]2458-all the galleries are shut . ”[167-miss alan]

“ [I]129-lucy think [I]129-lucy shall go out , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy . “ [I]129-lucy want to go round [the town]2459-the town in [the circular tram]2460-the circular tram — on the platform by [the driver]2281-the driver . ”[129-lucy]

[[Her]129-lucy two companions]701-her two companions looked grave . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , who felt responsible for [her]129-lucy in the absence of [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , ventured to say :

“ [I]133-mr. beebe wish [we]2462-we could . Unluckily [I]133-mr. beebe have letters . If [you]129-lucy do want to go out alone , wo n’t [you]129-lucy be better on [your]129-lucy feet ? ”[133-mr. beebe]

But [they]701-her two companions still looked disapproval , and [she]129-lucy so far conceded to [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe as to say that [she]129-lucy would only go for a little walk , and keep to [the street frequented by [tourists]602-tourists]702-the street frequented by tourists .

Chapter IV Fourth Chapter

[Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe was right . [Lucy]129-lucy never knew [her]129-lucy desires so clearly as after music . [She]129-lucy had not really appreciated [the clergyman]380-the clergyman ’s wit , nor the suggestive twitterings of [Miss Alan]167-miss alan . Conversation was tedious ; [she]129-lucy wanted something big , and [she]129-lucy believed that it would have come to [her]129-lucy on the wind - swept platform of [an electric tram]461-an electric tram . This [she]129-lucy might not attempt . It was unladylike . Why ? Why were most big things unladylike ? [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett had once explained to [her]129-lucy why . It was not that [ladies]706-ladies were inferior to [men]2188-men ; it was that [they]706-ladies were different . [Their]706-ladies mission was to inspire [others]708-others to achievement rather than to achieve [themselves]706-ladies . Indirectly , by means of tact and a spotless name , [a lady]709-a lady could accomplish much . But if [she]129-lucy rushed into the fray [herself]129-lucy [she]129-lucy would be first censured , then despised , and finally ignored . Poems had been written to illustrate this point .

There is much that is immortal in [this medieval lady]710-this medieval lady . The dragons have gone , and so have [the knights]711-the knights , but still [she]129-lucy lingers in [our]712-our midst . [She]129-lucy reigned in many [an early Victorian castle]713-an early victorian castle , and was [Queen of much early Victorian song]714-queen of much early victorian song . It is sweet to protect [her]129-lucy in the intervals of business , sweet to pay [her]129-lucy honour when [she]129-lucy has cooked [our]712-our dinner well . But alas ! the creature grows degenerate . In [her]129-lucy heart also there are springing up strange desires . [She]129-lucy too is enamoured of heavy winds , and vast panoramas , and green expanses of [the sea]715-the sea . [She]129-lucy has marked [the kingdom of [this world]614-this world]624-the kingdom of this world , how full [it]624-the kingdom of this world is of wealth , and beauty , and war — a radiant crust , built around the central fires , spinning towards the receding heavens . [Men]2188-men , declaring that [she]129-lucy inspires [them]2188-men to it , move joyfully over the surface , having the most delightful meetings with [other men]719-other men , happy , not because [they]719-other men are masculine , but because [they]719-other men are alive . Before the show breaks up [she]129-lucy would like to drop the august title of [the Eternal Woman]720-the eternal woman , and go [there]382-there as [her]129-lucy transitory self .

[Lucy]129-lucy does not stand for [the medieval lady]722-the medieval lady , who was rather an ideal to which [she]129-lucy was bidden to lift [her]129-lucy eyes when feeling serious . Nor has [she]129-lucy any system of revolt . Here and there a restriction annoyed [her]129-lucy particularly , and [she]129-lucy would transgress it , and perhaps be sorry that [she]129-lucy had done so . This afternoon [she]129-lucy was peculiarly restive . [She]129-lucy would really like to do something of which [[her]129-lucy well - wishers]723-her well - wishers disapproved . As [she]129-lucy might not go on [the electric tram]724-the electric tram , [she]129-lucy went to [[Alinari]181-alinari ’s shop]725-alinari ’s shop .

There [she]129-lucy bought a photograph of [Botticelli]182-botticelli ’s “ Birth of [Venus]183-venus . ”[183-venus] [Venus]183-venus , being a pity , spoilt the picture , otherwise so charming , and [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett had persuaded [her]129-lucy to do without it . ( A pity in art of course signified the nude . ) [Giorgione]184-giorgione ’s “ Tempesta , ”[128-miss bartlett] the “ Idolino , ”[128-miss bartlett] some of the Sistine frescoes and [the Apoxyomenos]726-the apoxyomenos , were added to it . [She]129-lucy felt a little calmer then , and bought [Fra Angelico]185-fra angelico ’s “ Coronation , ”[129-lucy] [Giotto]159-giotto ’s “ Ascension of [St. John]165-st. john , ”[129-lucy] [some Della Robbia babies]727-some della robbia babies , and [some Guido Reni Madonnas]728-some guido reni madonnas . For [her]129-lucy taste was catholic , and [she]129-lucy extended uncritical approval to every well - known name .

But though [she]129-lucy spent nearly seven lire , the gates of liberty seemed still unopened . [She]129-lucy was conscious of [her]129-lucy discontent ; it was new to [her]129-lucy to be conscious of it . “ [The world]333-the world , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy thought , “ is certainly full of beautiful things , if only [I]129-lucy could come across them . ”[129-lucy] It was not surprising that [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch disapproved of music , declaring that it always left [[her]134-mrs. honeychurch daughter]406-her daughter peevish , unpractical , and touchy .

“ Nothing ever happens to [me]129-lucy , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy reflected , as [she]129-lucy entered [the Piazza Signoria]730-the piazza signoria and looked nonchalantly at [its]730-the piazza signoria marvels , now fairly familiar to [her]129-lucy . [She]129-lucy fixed [her]129-lucy eyes wistfully on [the tower of [the palace]740-the palace]739-the tower of the palace , which rose out of the lower darkness like a pillar of roughened gold . Then something did happen .

[Two Italians by [the Loggia]734-the loggia]743-two italians by the loggia had been bickering about a debt . “ Cinque lire , ”[743-two italians by the loggia] [they]743-two italians by the loggia had cried , “ cinque lire ! ”[743-two italians by the loggia] [They]743-two italians by the loggia sparred at [each other]666-each other , and one of [them]743-two italians by the loggia was hit lightly upon the chest . [She]129-lucy thought : “ Oh , what have [I]129-lucy done ? ”[129-lucy]

Chapter V Possibilities of [[a Pleasant Outing]786-a pleasant outing]786-a pleasant outing

It was [a family]788-a family saying that “ [you]2481-you never knew which way [Charlotte Bartlett]128-miss bartlett would turn . ”[129-lucy] [She]129-lucy was perfectly pleasant and sensible over [Lucy]129-lucy ’s adventure , found the abridged account of it quite adequate , and paid suitable tribute to the courtesy of [Mr. George Emerson]126-george . [She]129-lucy and [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish had had an adventure also . [They]789-they had been stopped at [the Dazio]57-the dazio coming back , and [the young officials there , who seemed impudent and désœuvré]790-the young officials there , who seemed impudent and désœuvré , had tried to search [their]789-they reticules for provisions . For good or for evil , [Lucy]129-lucy was left to face [her]129-lucy problem alone . [None of [[her]129-lucy friends]793-her friends]792-none of her friends had seen [her]129-lucy , either in [the Piazza]516-the piazza or , later on , by [the embankment]775-the embankment . This solitude oppressed [her]129-lucy ; [she]129-lucy was accustomed to have [her]129-lucy thoughts confirmed by [others]708-others or , at all events , contradicted ; it was too dreadful not to know whether [she]129-lucy was thinking right or wrong .

At breakfast next morning [she]129-lucy took decisive action . There were two plans between which [she]129-lucy had to choose . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe was walking up to [the Torre del Gallo]659-the torre del gallo with [the Emersons]164-the emersons and [some American ladies]798-some american ladies . Would [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett and [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy join the party ? [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett declined for [herself]128-miss bartlett ; [she]128-miss bartlett had been [there]382-there in the rain the previous afternoon . But [she]128-miss bartlett thought it an admirable idea for [Lucy]129-lucy , who hated shopping , changing money , fetching letters , and other irksome duties — all of which [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett must accomplish this morning and could easily accomplish alone .

“ How could [you]169-mr. eager think [she]128-miss bartlett was defending [them]2534-they ? ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , much discomfited by the unpleasant scene . [The shopman]862-the shopman was possibly listening .

“ [She]128-miss bartlett will find it difficult . For [that man]2502-that man has murdered [[his]2502-that man wife]2533-his wife in the sight of [God]170-god . ”[862-the shopman]

The addition of [God]170-god was striking . But [the chaplain]820-the chaplain was really trying to qualify a rash remark . A silence followed which might have been impressive , but was merely awkward . Then [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett hastily purchased [the Leaning Tower]63-the leaning tower , and led the way into [the street]654-the street .

“ [I]862-the shopman must be going , ”[862-the shopman] said [he]862-the shopman , shutting [his]862-the shopman eyes and taking out [his]862-the shopman watch .

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett thanked [him]862-the shopman for [his]862-the shopman kindness , and spoke with enthusiasm of the approaching drive .

“ Drive ? Oh , is [our]2537-we drive to come off ? ”[128-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]129-lucy was recalled to [her]129-lucy manners , and after a little exertion the complacency of [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager was restored .

“ Bother the drive ! ”[381-the girl] exclaimed [the girl]381-the girl , as soon as [he]169-mr. eager had departed . “ It is just the drive [we]2537-we had arranged with [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe without any fuss at all . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , who had intended to lament over [the Emersons]164-the emersons , was launched by this remark into unexpected thoughts .

“ If that is so , [dear]2190-dear — if the drive [we]2537-we and [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe are going with [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager is really the same as the one [we]2537-we are going with [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , then [I]128-miss bartlett foresee a sad kettle of fish . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ How ? ”[869-the graphic]

[They]866-they were now in [the newspaper - room at [the English bank]868-the english bank]867-the newspaper - room at the english bank . [Lucy]129-lucy stood by the central table , heedless of [Punch]193-punch and [the Graphic]869-the graphic , trying to answer , or at all events to formulate the questions rioting in [her]129-lucy brain . [The well - known world]870-the well - known world had broken up , and there emerged [Florence]22-florence , [a magic city]871-a magic city where [people]354-people thought and did the most extraordinary things . Murder , accusations of murder , [a lady clinging to [one man]676-one man and being rude to another]873-a lady clinging to one man and being rude to another — were these the daily incidents of [[her]129-lucy streets]875-her streets ? Was there more in [her]129-lucy frank beauty than met the eye — the power , perhaps , to evoke passions , good and bad , and to bring [them]876-them speedily to a fulfillment ?

[Happy Charlotte]194-happy charlotte , who , though greatly troubled over things that did not matter , seemed oblivious to things that did ; who could conjecture with admirable delicacy “ where things might lead to , ”[194-happy charlotte] but apparently lost sight of the goal as [she]129-lucy approached [it]877-it . Now [she]129-lucy was crouching in the corner trying to extract a circular note from a kind of linen nose - bag which hung in chaste concealment round [her]129-lucy neck . [She]129-lucy had been told that this was the only safe way to carry money in [Italy]19-italy ; it must only be broached within the walls of [the English bank]868-the english bank . As [she]129-lucy groped [she]129-lucy murmured : “ Whether it is [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe who forgot to tell [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager , or [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager who forgot when [he]169-mr. eager told [us]2540-us , or whether [they]2541-they have decided to leave [Eleanor]127-miss lavish out altogether — which [they]2541-they could scarcely do — but in any case [we]2540-us must be prepared . It is [you]2542-you [they]2541-they really want ; [I]129-lucy am only asked for appearances . [You]2542-you shall go with [the two gentlemen]2543-the two gentlemen , and [I]129-lucy and [Eleanor]127-miss lavish will follow behind . [A one - horse carriage]2544-a one - horse carriage would do for [us]2540-us . Yet how difficult it is ! ”[129-lucy]

“ It is indeed , ”[381-the girl] replied [the girl]381-the girl , with a gravity that sounded sympathetic .

“ What do [you]129-lucy think about it ? ”[128-miss bartlett] asked [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , flushed from the struggle , and buttoning up [her]128-miss bartlett dress .

“ [I]381-the girl do n’t know what [I]381-the girl think , nor what [I]381-the girl want . ”[381-the girl]
