“ Thank [you]381-the girl , [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , and pondered over the offer .

There were letters for [her]381-the girl at [the bureau]880-the bureau — one from [[her]381-the girl brother]881-her brother , full of athletics and biology ; one from [[her]381-the girl mother]493-her mother , delightful as only [[her]381-the girl mother]493-her mother ’s letters could be . [She]129-lucy had read in it of the crocuses which had been bought for yellow and were coming up puce , of [the new parlour - maid]884-the new parlour - maid , who had watered the ferns with essence of lemonade , of [the semi - detached cottages which were ruining [Summer Street]13-summer street , and breaking the heart of [Sir Harry Otway]156-sir harry]885-the semi - detached cottages which were ruining summer street , and breaking the heart of sir harry otway . [She]129-lucy recalled the free , pleasant life of [[her]129-lucy home]886-her home , where [she]129-lucy was allowed to do everything , and where nothing ever happened to [her]129-lucy . [The road]455-the road up through [the pine - woods]888-the pine - woods , [the clean drawing - room]889-the clean drawing - room , the view over [the Sussex Weald]64-the sussex weald — all hung before [her]129-lucy bright and distinct , but pathetic as the pictures in a gallery to which , after much experience , [a traveller]890-a traveller returns .

“ And the news ? ”[128-miss bartlett] asked [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett .

“ [Mrs. Vyse]131-mrs. vyse and [[her]131-mrs. vyse son]2548-her son have gone to [Rome]43-rome , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , giving the news that interested [her]129-lucy least . “ Do [you]129-lucy know [the Vyses]195-the vyses ? ”[129-lucy]

“ Oh , not that way back . [We]2549-we can never have too much of [the dear Piazza Signoria]2550-the dear piazza signoria . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [They]195-the vyses ’re [nice people]2551-nice people , [the Vyses]195-the vyses . So clever — [my]129-lucy idea of what ’s really clever . Do n’t [you]129-lucy long to be in [Rome]43-rome ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [I]128-miss bartlett die for it ! ”[128-miss bartlett]

[The Piazza Signoria]730-the piazza signoria is too stony to be brilliant . [It]730-the piazza signoria has no grass , no flowers , no frescoes , no glittering walls of marble or comforting patches of ruddy brick . By an odd chance — unless [we]892-we believe in a presiding genius of places — the statues that relieve its severity suggest , not the innocence of childhood , nor the glorious bewilderment of youth , but the conscious achievements of maturity . [Perseus]196-perseus and [Judith]197-judith , [Hercules]198-hercules and [Thusnelda]199-thusnelda , [they]893-they have done or suffered something , and though [they]893-they are immortal , immortality has come to [them]893-they after experience , not before . Here , not only in the solitude of Nature , might [a hero]894-a hero meet [a goddess]895-a goddess , or [a heroine]896-a heroine [a god]897-a god .

“ [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett ! ”[381-the girl] cried [the girl]381-the girl suddenly . “ Here ’s an idea . What if [we]892-we popped off to [Rome]43-rome to - morrow — straight to [the Vyses ’ hotel]2552-the vyses ’ hotel ? For [I]381-the girl do know what [I]381-the girl want . [I]381-the girl ’m sick of [Florence]22-florence . No , [you]381-the girl said [you]381-the girl ’d go to [the ends of [the earth]2344-the earth]2546-the ends of the earth ! Do ! Do ! ”[381-the girl]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , with equal vivacity , replied :

“ Oh , [[you]381-the girl droll person]2555-you droll person ! Pray , what would become of [your]381-the girl drive in [the hills]657-the hills ? ”[128-miss bartlett]

[They]899-they passed together through the gaunt beauty of [the square]2466-the square , laughing over the unpractical suggestion .

Chapter VI [The Reverend Arthur Beebe]124-the reverend arthur beebe , [the Reverend Cuthbert Eager]125-the reverend cuthbert eager , [Mr. Emerson]126-george , [Mr. George Emerson]126-george , [Miss Eleanor Lavish]127-miss lavish , [Miss Charlotte Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , and [Miss Lucy Honeychurch]129-lucy Drive Out in Carriages to See a View ; [Italians Drive]149-italians [Them]901-them .

It was [Phaethon]200-phaethon who drove [them]901-them to [Fiesole]15-fiesole that memorable day , [a youth all irresponsibility and fire]902-a youth all irresponsibility and fire , recklessly urging [[his]200-phaethon master]903-his master ’s horses up [the stony hill]904-the stony hill . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe recognized [him]200-phaethon at once . Neither the Ages of Faith nor the Age of Doubt had touched [him]200-phaethon ; [he]200-phaethon was [Phaethon]200-phaethon in [Tuscany]65-tuscany driving [a cab]905-a cab . And it was [Persephone]201-persephone whom [he]200-phaethon asked leave to pick up on the way , saying that [she]201-persephone was [[his]200-phaethon sister]906-his sister — [Persephone]201-persephone , tall and slender and pale , returning with the Spring to [[[her]201-persephone mother]493-her mother ’s cottage]908-her mother ’s cottage , and still shading [her]201-persephone eyes from the unaccustomed light . To [her]201-persephone [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager objected , saying that here was the thin edge of the wedge , and [one]424-one must guard against imposition . But [the ladies]348-the ladies interceded , and when it had been made clear that it was a very great favour , [the goddess]911-the goddess was allowed to mount beside [the god]912-the god .

[Phaethon]200-phaethon at once slipped the left rein over [her]201-persephone head , thus enabling [himself]200-phaethon to drive with [his]200-phaethon arm round [her]201-persephone waist . [She]201-persephone did not mind . [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager , who sat with [his]169-mr. eager back to the horses , saw nothing of the indecorous proceeding , and continued [his]169-mr. eager conversation with [Lucy]129-lucy . [The other two occupants of]913-the other two occupants of [the carriage]914-the carriage were [old Mr. Emerson]126-george and [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish . For a dreadful thing had happened : [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , without consulting [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager , had doubled the size of [the party]915-the party . And though [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett and [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish had planned all the morning how [the people]916-the people were to sit , at the critical moment when [the carriages]917-the carriages came round [they]916-the people lost [their]916-the people heads , and [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish got in with [Lucy]129-lucy , while [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , with [George Emerson]126-george and [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , followed on behind .

It was hard on [the poor chaplain]918-the poor chaplain to have [his]918-the poor chaplain partie carrée thus transformed . Tea at [a Renaissance villa]838-a renaissance villa , if [he]918-the poor chaplain had ever meditated it , was now impossible . [Lucy]129-lucy and [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett had a certain style about [them]920-them , and [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , though unreliable , was [a man of parts]921-a man of parts . But [a shoddy lady writer and a journalist who had murdered [[his]133-mr. beebe wife]2533-his wife in the sight of [God]170-god]922-a shoddy lady writer and a journalist who had murdered his wife in the sight of god — [they]922-a shoddy lady writer and a journalist who had murdered his wife in the sight of god should enter [no villa]924-no villa at [his]133-mr. beebe introduction .

[Lucy]129-lucy , elegantly dressed in white , sat erect and nervous amid these explosive ingredients , attentive to [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager , repressive towards [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish , watchful of [old Mr. Emerson]126-george , hitherto fortunately asleep , thanks to a heavy lunch and the drowsy atmosphere of Spring . [She]129-lucy looked on the expedition as the work of [Fate]202-fate . But for it [she]129-lucy would have avoided [George Emerson]126-george successfully . In an open manner [he]126-george had shown that [he]126-george wished to continue [their]925-their intimacy . [She]129-lucy had refused , not because [she]129-lucy disliked [him]126-george , but because [she]129-lucy did not know what had happened , and suspected that [he]126-george did know . And this frightened [her]129-lucy .

For the real event — whatever it was — had taken place , not in [the Loggia]60-the loggia , but by [the river]456-the river . To behave wildly at the sight of death is pardonable . But to discuss it afterwards , to pass from discussion into silence , and through silence into sympathy , that is an error , not of a startled emotion , but of the whole fabric . There was really something blameworthy ( [she]129-lucy thought ) in [their]925-their joint contemplation of [the shadowy stream]927-the shadowy stream , in the common impulse which had turned [them]925-their to [the house]928-the house without the passing of a look or word . This sense of wickedness had been slight at first . [She]129-lucy had nearly joined the party to [the Torre del Gallo]66-the torre del gallo . But each time that [she]129-lucy avoided [George]126-george it became more imperative that [she]129-lucy should avoid [him]126-george again . And now [celestial irony]203-celestial irony , working through [[her]129-lucy cousin]364-her cousin and [two clergymen]930-two clergymen , did not suffer [her]129-lucy to leave [Florence]22-florence till [she]129-lucy had made this expedition with [him]126-george through [the hills]657-the hills .

[Meanwhile Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager held [her]129-lucy in civil converse ; [their]932-their little tiff was over .

“ So , [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy , [you]129-lucy are travelling ? As [a student of art]2557-a student of art ? ”[169-mr. eager]

“ [I]127-miss lavish quite agree , ”[127-miss lavish] said [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish , who had several times tried to interrupt [his]933-his mordant wit . “ The narrowness and superficiality of [the Anglo - Saxon tourist]2570-the anglo - saxon tourist is nothing less than a menace . ”[127-miss lavish]

“ Quite so . But [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager proceeded to tell [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy that on the right lived [Mr. Someone Something]205-mr. someone something , [an American of the best type]934-an american of the best type — so rare!—and that [the Somebody Elses]935-the somebody elses were farther down [the hill]936-the hill . “ Doubtless [you]129-lucy know [her]204-lady helen laverstock monographs in the series of ‘ Mediæval Byways ’ ? During this speech [the two figures on the box]937-the two figures on the box were sporting with each other disgracefully . [Lucy]129-lucy had a spasm of envy . [The carriage]914-the carriage swept with agonizing jolts up through [the Piazza of Fiesole]940-the piazza of fiesole and into [the Settignano road]941-the settignano road .

“ Piano ! piano ! ”[169-mr. eager] said [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager , elegantly waving [his]169-mr. eager hand over [his]169-mr. eager head .

“ Va bene , signore , [va bene]2582-va bene , va bene , ”[2281-the driver] crooned [the driver]2281-the driver , and whipped [his]2281-the driver horses up again .

Now [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager and [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish began to talk against [each other]666-each other on the subject of [Alessio Baldovinetti]189-alessio baldovinetti . “ Piano ! piano ! ”[189-alessio baldovinetti] said [he]189-alessio baldovinetti , with a martyred look at [Lucy]129-lucy .

An extra lurch made [him]189-alessio baldovinetti turn angrily in [his]189-alessio baldovinetti seat . [Phaethon]200-phaethon , who for some time had been endeavouring to kiss [Persephone]201-persephone , had just succeeded .

A little scene ensued , which , as [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett said afterwards , was most unpleasant . [The horses]947-the horses were stopped , [the lovers]948-the lovers were ordered to disentangle [themselves]948-the lovers , [the boy]772-the boy was to lose [his]772-the boy pourboire , [the girl]381-the girl was immediately to get down .

“ [She]381-the girl is [[my]189-alessio baldovinetti sister]2406-my sister , ”[189-alessio baldovinetti] said [he]189-alessio baldovinetti , turning round on [them]948-the lovers with piteous eyes .

[Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager took the trouble to tell [him]189-alessio baldovinetti that [he]189-alessio baldovinetti was [a liar]951-a liar .

[Phaethon]200-phaethon hung down [his]200-phaethon head , not at the matter of the accusation , but at its manner . “ [We]2584-we must not submit , ”[169-mr. eager] said [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager . “ [I]169-mr. eager knew [he]952-mr. emerson , whom the shock of stopping had awoke was trying it on . “ Surely no ! ”[127-miss lavish] said [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish , [her]127-miss lavish ardour visibly decreasing .

[The other carriage]945-the other carriage had drawn up behind , and [sensible Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe called out that after this warning [the couple]955-the couple would be sure to behave [themselves]955-the couple properly .

“ Leave [them]955-the couple alone , ”[126-george] [Mr. Emerson]126-george begged [the chaplain]820-the chaplain , of whom [he]126-george stood in no awe . “ Do [we]2584-we find happiness so often that [we]2584-we should turn it off the box when it happens to sit there ? To be driven by [lovers]2588-lovers — [A king]2589-a king might envy [us]2584-we , and if [we]2584-we part [them]955-the couple it ’s more like sacrilege than anything [I]820-the chaplain know . ”[820-the chaplain]

Here the voice of [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett was heard saying that [a crowd]746-a crowd had begun to collect .

[Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager , who suffered from an over - fluent tongue rather than a resolute will , was determined to make [himself]169-mr. eager heard . [He]169-mr. eager addressed [the driver]2281-the driver again . Italian in [the mouth of [Italians]149-italians]959-the mouth of italians is a deep - voiced stream , with unexpected cataracts and boulders to preserve it from monotony . In [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager ’s mouth it resembled nothing so much as an acid whistling fountain which played ever higher and higher , and quicker and quicker , and more and more shrilly , till abruptly it was turned off with a click .

[She]129-lucy did not answer . But never again were they in such profusion ; [this terrace]1028-this terrace was the well - head , the primal source whence beauty gushed out to water [the earth]2344-the earth .

[George]126-george had turned at the sound of [her]129-lucy arrival . For a moment [he]1000-the miscreant contemplated [her]129-lucy , as one who had fallen out of heaven . [He]1000-the miscreant stepped quickly forward and kissed [her]129-lucy .

[Chapter VII]213-chapter vii [They]1032-them Return

Some complicated game had been playing up and down [the hillside]2500-the hillside all the afternoon . What it was and exactly how [the players]1034-the players had sided , [Lucy]129-lucy was slow to discover . [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager had met [them]1032-them with a questioning eye . [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett had repulsed [him]169-mr. eager with much small talk . [Mr. Emerson]126-george , seeking [[his]126-george son]366-his son , was told whereabouts to find [him]366-his son . [Mr. Beebe , who wore the heated aspect of a neutral]1036-mr. beebe , who wore the heated aspect of a neutral , was bidden to collect the factions for the return [home]428-home . There was a general sense of groping and bewilderment . [Pan]133-mr. beebe had been amongst [them]1032-them — not [the great god [Pan]133-mr. beebe , who has been buried these two thousand years , but [the little god Pan]1038-the little god pan , who presides over social contretemps and unsuccessful picnics . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe had lost [everyone]2229-everyone , and had consumed in solitude the tea - basket which [he]133-mr. beebe had brought up as a pleasant surprise]133-mr. beebe . [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish had lost [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett . [Lucy]129-lucy had lost [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager . [Mr. Emerson]126-george had lost [George]126-george . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett had lost a mackintosh square . [Phaethon]200-phaethon had lost the game .

That last fact was undeniable . [He]200-phaethon climbed on to the box shivering , with [his]200-phaethon collar up , prophesying the swift approach of bad weather . “ Let [us]1032-them go immediately , ”[200-phaethon] [he]200-phaethon told [them]1032-them . “ [The signorino]2621-the signorino will walk . ”[200-phaethon]

“ All the way ? [He]2621-the signorino will be hours , ”[133-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe .

“ Apparently . [He]200-phaethon alone had played skilfully , using the whole of [his]200-phaethon instinct , while [the others]1041-the others had used scraps of [their]1041-the others intelligence . [He]200-phaethon alone had divined what things were , and what [he]200-phaethon wished them to be . [He]200-phaethon alone had interpreted the message that [Lucy]129-lucy had received five days before from the lips of [a dying man]1042-a dying man . [Persephone]201-persephone , who spends half [her]201-persephone life in the grave — [she]201-persephone could interpret it also . Not so these English . [They]1043-they gain knowledge slowly , and perhaps too late .

The thoughts of [a cab - driver]1044-a cab - driver , however just , seldom affect the lives of [[his]1044-a cab - driver employers]1045-his employers . [He]200-phaethon was [the most competent of [[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett ’s opponents]1047-miss bartlett ’s opponents]1046-the most competent of miss bartlett ’s opponents , but infinitely the least dangerous . Once back in [the town]2459-the town , [he]200-phaethon and [his]200-phaethon insight and [his]200-phaethon knowledge would trouble [English ladies]1049-english ladies no more . Of course , it was most unpleasant ; [she]129-lucy had seen [his]200-phaethon black head in the bushes ; [he]200-phaethon might make a tavern story out of it . But after all , what have [we]1050-we to do with [taverns]1051-taverns ? Real menace belongs to the drawing - room . It was of drawing - room people that [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett thought as [she]129-lucy journeyed downwards towards the fading sun . [Lucy]129-lucy sat beside [her]128-miss bartlett ; [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager sat opposite , trying to catch [her]129-lucy eye ; [he]169-mr. eager was vaguely suspicious . [They]1052-they spoke of [Alessio Baldovinetti]189-alessio baldovinetti .

Rain and darkness came on together . [The two ladies]2405-the two ladies huddled together under an inadequate parasol . There was a lightning flash , and [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish who was nervous , screamed from [the carriage]914-the carriage in front . At the next flash , [Lucy]129-lucy screamed also . [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager addressed [her]129-lucy professionally :

“ Courage , [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy , courage and faith . If [I]169-mr. eager might say so , there is something almost blasphemous in this horror of the elements . Are [we]1056-we seriously to suppose that all these clouds , all this immense electrical display , is simply called into existence to extinguish [you]129-lucy or [me]169-mr. eager ? ”[169-mr. eager]

“ No — of course — ”[169-mr. eager]

“ Even from the scientific standpoint the chances against [our]1056-we being struck are enormous . The steel knives , the only articles which might attract the current , are in [the other carriage]945-the other carriage . And , in any case , [we]1056-we are infinitely safer than if [we]1056-we were walking . Courage — courage and faith . ”[169-mr. eager]

Under the rug , [Lucy]129-lucy felt the kindly pressure of [[her]129-lucy cousin]364-her cousin ’s hand . At times [our]1056-we need for a sympathetic gesture is so great that [we]1056-we care not what exactly it signifies or how much [we]1056-we may have to pay for it afterwards . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , by this timely exercise of [her]128-miss bartlett muscles , gained more than [she]128-miss bartlett would have got in hours of preaching or cross examination .

[She]128-miss bartlett renewed it when [the two carriages]1057-the two carriages stopped , half into [Florence]22-florence .

[Her]381-the girl promise brought the long - drawn interview to a sudden close . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett pecked [her]381-the girl smartly on both cheeks , wished [her]381-the girl good - night , and sent [her]381-the girl to [[her]381-the girl own room]444-her own room .

For a moment the original trouble was in the background . [George]126-george would seem to have behaved like [a cad throughout]1108-a cad throughout ; perhaps that was the view which [one]424-one would take eventually . At present [she]381-the girl neither acquitted nor condemned [him]126-george ; [she]381-the girl did not pass judgement . At the moment when [she]381-the girl was about to judge [him]126-george [[her]381-the girl cousin]364-her cousin ’s voice had intervened , and , ever since , it was [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett who had dominated ; [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett who , [even now , could be heard sighing into a crack in the partition wall]1111-even now , could be heard sighing into a crack in the partition wall ; [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , who had really been [neither pliable nor humble nor inconsistent]216-neither pliable nor humble nor inconsistent . [She]381-the girl had worked like [a great artist]856-a great artist ; for a time — indeed , for years — [she]381-the girl had been meaningless , but at the end there was presented to [the girl]381-the girl the complete picture of a cheerless , loveless world in which [the young]1114-the young rush to destruction until [they]1114-the young learn better — a shamefaced world of precautions and barriers which may avert evil , but which do not seem to bring good , if [we]1115-we may judge from [those who have used them most]1116-those who have used them most .

[Lucy]129-lucy was suffering from the most grievous wrong which [this world]614-this world has yet discovered : diplomatic advantage had been taken of [her]129-lucy sincerity , of [her]129-lucy craving for sympathy and love . Such a wrong is not easily forgotten . Never again did [she]129-lucy expose [herself]129-lucy without due consideration and precaution against rebuff . And such a wrong may react disastrously upon the soul .

The door - bell rang , and [she]129-lucy started to the shutters . Before [she]129-lucy reached them [she]129-lucy hesitated , turned , and blew out the candle . Thus it was that , though [she]129-lucy saw [someone standing in the wet below]1118-someone standing in the wet below , [he]1118-someone standing in the wet below , though [he]1118-someone standing in the wet below looked up , did not see [her]129-lucy .

To reach [[his]1118-someone standing in the wet below room]1119-his room [he]1118-someone standing in the wet below had to go by [hers]129-lucy . [She]129-lucy was still dressed . It struck [her]129-lucy that [she]129-lucy might slip into [the passage]1120-the passage and just say that [she]129-lucy would be gone before [he]1118-someone standing in the wet below was up , and that [their]1121-their extraordinary intercourse was over .

Whether [she]129-lucy would have dared to do this was never proved . At the critical moment [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett opened [her]128-miss bartlett own door , and [her]128-miss bartlett voice said :

“ [I]128-miss bartlett wish one word with [you]1118-someone standing in the wet below in [the drawing - room]432-the drawing - room , [Mr. Emerson]126-george , please . ”[128-miss bartlett]

Soon [their]1121-their footsteps returned , and [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett said : “ Good - night , [Mr. Emerson]126-george . ”[128-miss bartlett]

[His]1118-someone standing in the wet below heavy , tired breathing was the only reply ; [the chaperon]1122-the chaperon had done [her]1122-the chaperon work .

[Lucy]129-lucy cried aloud : “ It is n’t true . It ca n’t all be true . [I]129-lucy want not to be muddled . [I]129-lucy want to grow older quickly . ”[129-lucy]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett tapped on the wall .

“ Go to bed at once , [dear]2190-dear . [You]2190-dear need all the rest [you]2190-dear can get . ”[128-miss bartlett]

In the morning [they]1121-their left for [Rome]43-rome .

PART TWO

Chapter VIII Medieval

The drawing - room curtains at [Windy Corner]14-windy corner had been pulled to meet , for the carpet was new and deserved protection from the August sun . They were heavy curtains , reaching almost to the ground , and the light that filtered through them was subdued and varied . [A poet]1123-a poet — [none was present]1124-none was present — might have quoted , “ Life like a dome of many coloured glass , ”[1123-a poet] or might have compared the curtains to sluice - gates , lowered against the intolerable tides of heaven . Without was poured a sea of radiance ; within , the glory , though visible , was tempered to the capacities of [man]2360-man .

[Two pleasant people]1126-two pleasant people sat in [the room]373-the room . [One]217-one — [a boy of nineteen]1128-a boy of nineteen — was studying a small manual of anatomy , and peering occasionally at a bone which lay upon the piano . From time to time [he]217-one bounced in [his]217-one chair and puffed and groaned , for the day was hot and the print small , and the human frame fearfully made ; and [[his]217-one mother]1129-his mother , who was writing a letter , did continually read out to [him]217-one what [she]1129-his mother had written . And continually did [she]1129-his mother rise from [her]1129-his mother seat and part the curtains so that a rivulet of light fell across the carpet , and make the remark that they were still there .

“ Where are n’t [they]1126-two pleasant people ? ”[772-the boy] said [the boy]772-the boy , who was [Freddy]135-freddy , [[Lucy]129-lucy ’s brother]1131-lucy ’s brother . “ [I]772-the boy tell [you]134-mrs. honeychurch [I]772-the boy ’m getting fairly sick . ”[772-the boy]

“ For goodness ’ sake go out of [[my]134-mrs. honeychurch drawing - room]2684-my drawing - room , then ? ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] cried [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , who hoped to cure [[her]134-mrs. honeychurch children]1132-her children of slang by taking it literally .

[Freddy]135-freddy did not move or reply .

“ [I]134-mrs. honeychurch think things are coming to a head , ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] [she]134-mrs. honeychurch observed , rather wanting [[her]134-mrs. honeychurch son]2548-her son ’s opinion on the situation if [she]134-mrs. honeychurch could obtain it without undue supplication .

“ Time [they]1126-two pleasant people did . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ [I]134-mrs. honeychurch am glad that [Cecil]256-cecil is asking [her]134-mrs. honeychurch this once more . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ Do [you]135-freddy indeed , [dear]2190-dear ? How interesting ! ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

[He]135-freddy returned to [his]135-freddy work .

“ [I]1134-i said : ‘ [Dear Mrs. Vyse]131-mrs. vyse , [Cecil]256-cecil has just asked [my]1134-i permission about it , and [I]1134-i should be delighted , if [Lucy]129-lucy wishes it . The curtains parted .

[Cecil]256-cecil ’s first movement was one of irritation . [He]256-cecil could n’t bear the [Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch habit of sitting in the dark to save the furniture . [Cecil]256-cecil entered .

Appearing thus late in the story , [Cecil]256-cecil must be at once described . [He]256-cecil was medieval . Like a Gothic statue . Tall and refined , with shoulders that seemed braced square by an effort of the will , and a head that was tilted a little higher than the usual level of vision , [he]256-cecil resembled [those fastidious saints who guard the portals of [a French cathedral]1155-a french cathedral]1154-those fastidious saints who guard the portals of a french cathedral . Well educated , well endowed , and not deficient physically , [he]256-cecil remained in the grip of [a certain devil whom [the modern world knows as self - consciousness]1157-the modern world knows as self - consciousness , and whom [the medieval , with dimmer vision]1158-the medieval , with dimmer vision , worshipped as asceticism]1156-a certain devil whom the modern world knows as self - consciousness , and whom the medieval , with dimmer vision , worshipped as asceticism . A Gothic statue implies celibacy , just as a Greek statue implies fruition , and perhaps this was what [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe meant . And [Freddy]135-freddy , who ignored history and art , perhaps meant the same when [he]135-freddy failed to imagine [Cecil]256-cecil wearing [another fellow]1147-another fellow ’s cap .

“ Yes , [you]256-cecil go with [Lucy]222-lucy . ”[256-cecil]

[They]1169-they passed into the sunlight . [Cecil]256-cecil watched [them]1169-they cross [the terrace]1170-the terrace , and descend out of sight by the steps . [They]1169-they would descend — [he]256-cecil knew [their]1169-they ways — past the shrubbery , and past [the tennis - lawn]1171-the tennis - lawn and the dahlia - bed , until [they]1169-they reached [the kitchen garden]1172-the kitchen garden , and there , in the presence of the potatoes and the peas , the great event would be discussed .

Smiling indulgently , [he]256-cecil lit a cigarette , and rehearsed the events that had led to such a happy conclusion .

[He]256-cecil had known [Lucy]222-lucy for several years , but only as [a commonplace girl who happened to be musical]1173-a commonplace girl who happened to be musical . [He]256-cecil could still remember [his]256-cecil depression that afternoon at [Rome]43-rome , when [she]222-lucy and [[her]222-lucy terrible cousin]1174-her terrible cousin fell on [him]256-cecil out of the blue , and demanded to be taken to [St. Peter ’s]12-st. peter . That day [she]222-lucy had seemed [a typical tourist — shrill , crude , and gaunt with travel]1175-a typical tourist — shrill , crude , and gaunt with travel . But [Italy]19-italy worked some marvel in [her]222-lucy . It gave [her]222-lucy light , and — which [he]256-cecil held more precious — it gave [her]222-lucy shadow . Soon [he]256-cecil detected in [her]222-lucy a wonderful reticence . [She]222-lucy was like [a woman of [Leonardo da Vinci]223-leonardo da vinci ’s]1176-a woman of leonardo da vinci ’s , whom [we]1177-we love not so much for [herself]222-lucy as for the things that [she]222-lucy will not tell [us]1177-we . The things are assuredly not of this life ; [no woman of [Leonardo]223-leonardo da vinci ’s]1178-no woman of leonardo ’s could have anything so vulgar as a “ story . ”[222-lucy] [She]222-lucy did develop most wonderfully day by day .

So it happened that from patronizing civility [he]256-cecil had slowly passed if not to passion , at least to a profound uneasiness . Already at [Rome]43-rome [he]256-cecil had hinted to [her]222-lucy that [they]1179-they might be suitable for each other . It had touched [him]256-cecil greatly that [she]222-lucy had not broken away at the suggestion . [Her]222-lucy refusal had been clear and gentle ; after it — as the horrid phrase went — [she]222-lucy had been exactly the same to [him]256-cecil as before . Three months later , on [the margin of [Italy]19-italy]1180-the margin of italy , among [the flower - clad Alps]1181-the flower - clad alps , [he]256-cecil had asked [her]222-lucy again in bald , traditional language . [She]222-lucy reminded [him]256-cecil of [a Leonardo]1182-a leonardo more than ever ; [her]222-lucy sunburnt features were shadowed by fantastic rock ; at [his]256-cecil words [she]222-lucy had turned and stood between [him]256-cecil and the light with immeasurable plains behind [her]222-lucy . [He]256-cecil walked [home]428-home with [her]222-lucy unashamed , feeling not at all like [a rejected suitor]1184-a rejected suitor . The things that really mattered were unshaken .

So now [he]256-cecil had asked [her]222-lucy once more , and , clear and gentle as ever , [she]222-lucy had accepted [him]256-cecil , giving no coy reasons for [her]222-lucy delay , but simply saying that [she]222-lucy loved [him]256-cecil and would do [her]222-lucy best to make [him]256-cecil happy . [[His]256-cecil mother]1129-his mother , too , would be pleased ; [she]222-lucy had counselled the step ; [he]256-cecil must write [her]222-lucy a long account .

Glancing at [his]256-cecil hand , in case any of [Freddy]135-freddy ’s chemicals had come off on it , [he]256-cecil moved to the writing table . There [he]256-cecil saw “ [Dear Mrs. Vyse]131-mrs. vyse , ”[256-cecil] followed by many erasures . [He]256-cecil recoiled without reading any more , and after a little hesitation sat down elsewhere , and pencilled a note on [his]256-cecil knee .

Then [he]256-cecil lit another cigarette , which did not seem quite as divine as the first , and considered what might be done to make [Windy Corner drawing - room]1186-windy corner drawing - room more distinctive . With that outlook it should have been [a successful room]1187-a successful room , but the trail of [Tottenham Court Road]74-tottenham court road was upon it ; [he]256-cecil could almost visualize [the motor - vans of [Messrs. Maple]225-messrs. maple arriving at the door and depositing this chair , those varnished book - cases , that writing - table . The table recalled [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch ’s letter . Occasionally [he]256-cecil could be quite crude .

“ Not that . But [you]380-the clergyman ought to have stopped [me]256-cecil . [I]256-cecil know [Miss Honeychurch]129-lucy only a little as time goes . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe pulled [himself]133-mr. beebe together . Really , [Mr. Vyse]219-mr. vyse had the art of placing one in the most tiresome positions . [He]219-mr. vyse was driven to use the prerogatives of [his]219-mr. vyse profession .

“ No , [I]219-mr. vyse have said nothing indiscreet . [I]219-mr. vyse foresaw at [Florence]22-florence that [her]129-lucy quiet , uneventful childhood must end , and it has ended . “ [Grazie tante]2746-grazie tante ! ”[256-cecil] said [Cecil]256-cecil , who did not like parsons .

“ Have [you]135-freddy heard ? ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] shouted [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch as [she]134-mrs. honeychurch toiled up [the sloping garden]1219-the sloping garden . “ Oh , [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , have [you]135-freddy heard the news ? ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

[Freddy]135-freddy , now full of geniality , whistled the wedding march . [Youth]235-youth seldom criticizes the accomplished fact .

“ Indeed [I]135-freddy have ! ”[135-freddy] [he]135-freddy cried . [He]135-freddy looked at [Lucy]129-lucy . “ [You]1220-the parson only asked for it just in time , ”[1221-the lady] [the lady]1221-the lady retorted . “ How dare [you]1221-the lady be serious at [Windy Corner]14-windy corner ? ”[1221-the lady]

[He]1220-the parson took [his]1220-the parson tone from [her]1221-the lady . There was no more heavy beneficence , no more attempts to dignify the situation with poetry or the Scriptures . [None of [them]1223-they]1222-none of them dared or was able to be serious any more .

An engagement is so potent a thing that sooner or later it reduces [all who speak of it to this state of cheerful awe]1224-all who speak of it to this state of cheerful awe . Away from it , in the solitude of [[their]1223-they rooms]2253-their rooms , [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , and even [Freddy]135-freddy , might again be critical . But in its presence and in the presence of [each other]666-each other [they]1223-they were sincerely hilarious . It has a strange power , for it compels not only the lips , but the very heart . The chief parallel to compare one great thing with another — is the power over [us]1227-we of [a temple of some alien creed]1228-a temple of some alien creed . Standing outside , [we]1227-we deride or oppose it , or at the most feel sentimental . Inside , though [the saints and gods]1229-the saints and gods are not ours , [we]1227-we become [true believers]1230-true believers , in case [any true believer]1231-any true believer should be present .

So it was that after the gropings and the misgivings of the afternoon [they]1223-they pulled [themselves]1223-they together and settled down to a very pleasant tea - party . If [they]1223-they were [hypocrites]1232-hypocrites [they]1223-they did not know it , and [their]1223-they hypocrisy had every chance of setting and of becoming true . [Anne]231-anne , putting down each plate as if it were a wedding present , stimulated [them]1223-they greatly . [They]1223-they could not lag behind that smile of [hers]231-anne which [she]231-anne gave [them]1223-they ere [she]231-anne kicked the drawing - room door . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe chirruped . [Freddy]135-freddy was at [his]135-freddy wittiest , referring to [Cecil]256-cecil as the “ Fiasco”—family[135-freddy] honoured pun on [fiance]1233-fiance . [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , amusing and portly , promised well as [a mother - in - law]1234-a mother - in - law . As for [Lucy]129-lucy and [Cecil]256-cecil , for whom [the temple]1235-the temple had been built , [they]1223-they also joined in the merry ritual , but waited , as [earnest worshippers]1236-earnest worshippers should , for the disclosure of some holier shrine of joy .

Chapter IX [Lucy]129-lucy As a Work of Art

A few days after the engagement was announced [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch made [Lucy]129-lucy and [her]134-mrs. honeychurch [Fiasco]236-fiasco come to a little garden - party in [the neighbourhood]2489-the neighbourhood , for naturally [she]134-mrs. honeychurch wanted to show [people]354-people that [[her]134-mrs. honeychurch daughter]406-her daughter was marrying [a presentable man]1240-a presentable man .

[Cecil]256-cecil was more than presentable ; [he]256-cecil looked distinguished , and it was very pleasant to see [his]256-cecil slim figure keeping step with [Lucy]129-lucy , and [his]256-cecil long , fair face responding when [Lucy]129-lucy spoke to [him]256-cecil . [People]354-people congratulated [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , which is , [I]0-i believe , a social blunder , but it pleased [her]134-mrs. honeychurch , and [she]134-mrs. honeychurch introduced [Cecil]256-cecil rather indiscriminately to [some stuffy dowagers]1242-some stuffy dowagers .

At tea a misfortune took place : a cup of coffee was upset over [Lucy]129-lucy ’s figured silk , and though [Lucy]129-lucy feigned indifference , [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother feigned nothing of the sort but dragged [her]129-lucy indoors to have the frock treated by [a sympathetic maid]1244-a sympathetic maid . [They]1245-they were gone some time , and [Cecil]256-cecil was left with [the dowagers]1246-the dowagers . When [they]1245-they returned [he]256-cecil was not as pleasant as [he]256-cecil had been .

“ Do [you]129-lucy go to much of this sort of thing ? ”[256-cecil] [he]256-cecil asked when [they]1245-they were driving [home]428-home .

“ Oh , now and then , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , who had rather enjoyed [herself]129-lucy .

“ Is it typical of country society ? ”[256-cecil]

“ [I]134-mrs. honeychurch suppose so . [Mother]147-mother , would it be ? ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ Plenty of society , ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , who was trying to remember the hang of one of the dresses .

Seeing that [her]134-mrs. honeychurch thoughts were elsewhere , [Cecil]256-cecil bent towards [Lucy]129-lucy and said :

“ To [me]256-cecil it seemed perfectly appalling , disastrous , portentous . ”[256-cecil]

“ [I]134-mrs. honeychurch am so sorry that [you]256-cecil were stranded . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ Not that , but the congratulations . It is so disgusting , the way an engagement is regarded as public property — a kind of waste place where [every outsider]2752-every outsider may shoot [his]2752-every outsider vulgar sentiment . [All those old women]2753-all those old women smirking ! ”[256-cecil]

“ [One]424-one has to go through it , [I]134-mrs. honeychurch suppose . [They]2753-all those old women wo n’t notice [us]2755-us so much next time . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ But [my]256-cecil point is that [their]2753-all those old women whole attitude is wrong . An engagement — horrid word in the first place — is a private matter , and should be treated as such . ”[256-cecil]

Yet [the smirking old women]1248-the smirking old women , however wrong individually , were racially correct . The spirit of [the generations]1249-the generations had smiled through [them]1248-the smirking old women , rejoicing in the engagement of [Cecil]256-cecil and [Lucy]129-lucy because it promised the continuance of life on [earth]760-earth . To [Cecil]256-cecil and [Lucy]129-lucy it promised something quite different — personal love . Hence [Cecil]256-cecil ’s irritation and [Lucy]129-lucy ’s belief that [his]256-cecil irritation was just .

“ How tiresome ! ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy said . “ Could n’t [you]256-cecil have escaped to tennis ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [I]129-lucy do n’t play tennis — at least , not in public . [The neighbourhood]2489-the neighbourhood is deprived of the romance of [me]129-lucy being athletic . Such romance as [I]129-lucy have is that of [the Inglese Italianato]237-the inglese italianato . ”[129-lucy]

“ [Inglese Italianato]237-the inglese italianato ? ”[129-lucy]

“ E un diavolo incarnato ! [You]256-cecil know the proverb ? ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy did not . Nor did it seem applicable to [a young man who had spent a quiet winter in [Rome]43-rome with [[his]1251-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother mother]1129-his mother]1251-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother . But [Cecil]256-cecil , since [his]256-cecil engagement , had taken to affect a cosmopolitan naughtiness which [he]256-cecil was far from possessing .

“ Well , ”[256-cecil] said [he]256-cecil , “ [I]256-cecil can not help it if [they]2757-they do disapprove of [me]256-cecil . There are certain irremovable barriers between [myself]256-cecil and [them]2757-they , and [I]256-cecil must accept them . ”[256-cecil]

“ [We]2758-we all have [our]2758-we limitations , [I]129-lucy suppose , ”[129-lucy] said [wise Lucy]129-lucy .

“ Sometimes [they]2757-they are forced on [us]2758-we , though , ”[256-cecil] said [Cecil]256-cecil , who saw from [her]129-lucy remark that [she]129-lucy did not quite understand [his]256-cecil position .

“ How ? ”[256-cecil]

“ It makes a difference does n’t it , whether [we]2758-we fully fence [ourselves]2758-we in , or whether [we]2758-we are fenced out by the barriers of [others]708-others ? ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy thought a moment , and agreed that it did make a difference .

“ Difference ? ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] cried [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , suddenly alert . “ [I]134-mrs. honeychurch do n’t see any difference . Fences are fences , especially when they are in the same place . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ [We]2758-we were speaking of motives , ”[256-cecil] said [Cecil]256-cecil , on whom the interruption jarred .

“ [[My]129-lucy dear]2232-my dear [Cecil]256-cecil , look here . ”[129-lucy] [She]129-lucy spread out [her]129-lucy knees and perched [her]129-lucy card - case on [her]129-lucy lap . “ This is [me]129-lucy . That ’s [Windy Corner]14-windy corner . The rest of the pattern is [the other people]2761-the other people . Motives are all very well , but the fence comes here . ”[129-lucy]

“ [We]2758-we were n’t talking of real fences , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , laughing .

“ Oh , [I]129-lucy see , dear — poetry . ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy leant placidly back . [Cecil]256-cecil wondered why [Lucy]129-lucy had been amused .

“ [I]129-lucy tell [you]256-cecil who has no ‘ fences , ’ as [you]256-cecil call [them]354-people , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy said , “ and that ’s [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe . ”[129-lucy]

“ [A parson fenceless]2762-a parson fenceless would mean [a parson defenceless]2763-a parson defenceless . ”[129-lucy]

[Lucy]129-lucy was slow to follow what [people]354-people said , but quick enough to detect what [they]354-people meant . [She]129-lucy missed [Cecil]256-cecil ’s epigram , but grasped the feeling that prompted it .

“ Do n’t [you]256-cecil like [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe ? ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy asked thoughtfully .

“ [I]256-cecil never said so ! ”[256-cecil] [he]256-cecil cried . “ [I]256-cecil consider [him]133-mr. beebe far above the average . [I]256-cecil only denied — ”[256-cecil] And [he]256-cecil swept off on the subject of fences again , and was brilliant .

“ Now , [a clergyman that [I]129-lucy do hate]2764-a clergyman that i do hate , ”[129-lucy] said [she]129-lucy wanting to say something sympathetic , “ [a clergyman that does have fences , and the most dreadful ones]2765-a clergyman that does have fences , and the most dreadful ones , is [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager , [the English chaplain at [Florence]22-florence]2766-the english chaplain at florence . [He]169-mr. eager was truly insincere — not merely the manner unfortunate . [He]169-mr. eager was [a snob]499-a snob , and so conceited , and [he]169-mr. eager did say such unkind things . ”[129-lucy]

“ What sort of things ? ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ There was [an old man at the Bertolini whom [he]169-mr. eager said had murdered [[his]169-mr. eager wife]2533-his wife]2768-an old man at the bertolini whom he said had murdered his wife . ”[129-lucy]

“ Perhaps [he]169-mr. eager had . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ No ! ”[129-lucy]

“ Why ‘ no ’ ? ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ [He]169-mr. eager was such [a nice old man]2770-a nice old man , [I]129-lucy ’m sure . ”[129-lucy]

[Cecil]256-cecil laughed at [her]129-lucy feminine inconsequence .

“ Well , [I]134-mrs. honeychurch did try to sift the thing . [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager would never come to the point . [He]169-mr. eager prefers it vague — said [the old man]360-the old man had ‘ practically ’ murdered [[his]169-mr. eager wife]2533-his wife — had murdered [her]2533-his wife in the sight of [God]170-god . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ Hush , [dear]2190-dear ! ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch absently .

“ But is n’t it intolerable that [a person whom [we]2775-we ’re told to imitate]2774-a person whom we ’re told to imitate should go round spreading slander ? It was , [I]134-mrs. honeychurch believe , chiefly owing to [him]360-the old man that [the old man]360-the old man was dropped . [People]354-people pretended [he]360-the old man was vulgar , but [he]360-the old man certainly was n’t that . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ [Poor old man]2778-poor old man ! What was [his]2778-poor old man name ? ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ [Harris]156-sir harry , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy glibly .

“ Let ’s hope that [Mrs. Harris]238-mrs. harris there warn’t [no sich person]2779-no sich person , ”[493-her mother] said [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother .

[Cecil]256-cecil nodded intelligently .

“ Is n’t [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager [a parson of the cultured type]2780-a parson of the cultured type ? ”[256-cecil] [he]256-cecil asked .

“ [I]134-mrs. honeychurch do n’t know . [I]134-mrs. honeychurch hate [him]169-mr. eager . [I]134-mrs. honeychurch ’ve heard [him]169-mr. eager lecture on [Giotto]159-giotto . [I]134-mrs. honeychurch hate [him]169-mr. eager . Nothing can hide a petty nature . [I]134-mrs. honeychurch hate [him]169-mr. eager . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ [My]134-mrs. honeychurch goodness gracious [me]134-mrs. honeychurch , [child]2781-child ! ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch . “ [You]2781-child ’ll blow [my]134-mrs. honeychurch head off ! Whatever is there to shout over ? [I]134-mrs. honeychurch forbid [you]2781-child and [Cecil]256-cecil to hate [any more clergymen]2782-any more clergymen . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

[He]1255-he smiled . There was indeed something rather incongruous in [Lucy]129-lucy ’s moral outburst over [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager . It was as if [one]424-one should see the Leonardo on the ceiling of [the Sistine]77-the sistine . [He]1255-he longed to hint to [her]129-lucy that not here lay [her]129-lucy vocation ; that [a woman]1257-a woman ’s power and charm reside in mystery , not in muscular rant . But possibly rant is a sign of vitality : it mars [the beautiful creature]1258-the beautiful creature , but shows that [she]129-lucy is alive . After a moment , [he]1255-he contemplated [her]129-lucy flushed face and excited gestures with a certain approval . [He]1255-he forebore to repress the sources of youth .

Nature — simplest of topics , [he]1255-he thought — lay around [them]1259-them . [He]1255-he praised [the pine - woods]888-the pine - woods , the deep lasts of bracken , the crimson leaves that spotted the hurt - bushes , the serviceable beauty of [the turnpike road]1261-the turnpike road . [The outdoor world]1262-the outdoor world was not very familiar to [him]1255-he , and occasionally [he]1255-he went wrong in a question of fact . [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch ’s mouth twitched when [he]1255-he spoke of the perpetual green of the larch .

“ [I]1255-he count [myself]1255-he [a lucky person]2783-a lucky person , ”[1255-he] [he]1255-he concluded , “ When [I]1255-he ’m in [London]9-london [I]1255-he feel [I]1255-he could never live out of it . When [I]1255-he ’m in [the country]2204-the country [I]1255-he feel the same about [the country]2204-the country . After all , [I]1255-he do believe that birds and trees and the sky are the most wonderful things in life , and that [the people who live amongst them]2786-the people who live amongst them must be the best . It ’s true that in nine cases out of ten [they]2786-the people who live amongst them do n’t seem to notice anything . [The country gentleman]2787-the country gentleman and [the country labourer]2788-the country labourer are each in [their]2786-the people who live amongst them way the most depressing of [companions]2789-companions . Yet [they]2786-the people who live amongst them may have a tacit sympathy with the workings of Nature which is denied to [[us]2790-us of [the town]2459-the town]2791-us of the town . Do [you]134-mrs. honeychurch feel that , [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch ? ”[1255-he]

[Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch started and smiled . [She]134-mrs. honeychurch had not been attending . [Cecil]256-cecil , who was rather crushed on the front seat of [the victoria]1263-the victoria , felt irritable , and determined not to say anything interesting again .

[Lucy]129-lucy had not attended either . [Her]129-lucy brow was wrinkled , and [she]129-lucy still looked furiously cross — the result , [he]256-cecil concluded , of too much moral gymnastics . It was sad to see [her]129-lucy thus blind to the beauties of [an August wood]1264-an august wood .

“ ‘ Come down , [O maid]2793-o maid , from [yonder mountain height]2794-yonder mountain height , ’ ”[256-cecil] [he]256-cecil quoted , and touched [her]129-lucy knee with [his]256-cecil own .

[She]129-lucy flushed again and said : “ What height ? ”[129-lucy]

“ ‘ Come down , [O maid]2793-o maid , from yonder mountain height , What pleasure lives in height ( [the shepherd]2796-the shepherd sang ) . In height and in the splendour of [the hills]657-the hills ? ’[129-lucy]

Let [us]1265-us take [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch ’s advice and hate [clergymen]2233-clergymen no more . What ’s [this place]1267-this place ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [Summer Street]13-summer street , of course , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , and roused [herself]129-lucy .

[The woods]1268-the woods had opened to leave space for [a sloping triangular meadow]1269-a sloping triangular meadow . [Pretty cottages]1270-pretty cottages lined [it]1269-a sloping triangular meadow on two sides , and [the upper and third side]1271-the upper and third side was occupied by [a new stone church , expensively simple , a charming shingled spire]1272-a new stone church , expensively simple , a charming shingled spire . [[Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe ’s house]1273-mr. beebe ’s house was near [the church]2203-the church . In height [it]1273-mr. beebe ’s house scarcely exceeded [the cottages]1275-the cottages . [Some great mansions]1276-some great mansions were at hand , but [they]1276-some great mansions were hidden in the trees . The scene suggested [a Swiss Alp]78-a swiss alp rather than [the shrine]1277-the shrine and centre of [a leisured world]1278-a leisured world , and was marred only by [two ugly little villas]1279-two ugly little villas — [the villas that had competed with [Cecil]256-cecil ’s engagement]1280-the villas that had competed with cecil ’s engagement , having been acquired by [Sir Harry Otway]156-sir harry the very afternoon that [Lucy]129-lucy had been acquired by [Cecil]256-cecil .

“ [Cissie]228-cissie villa ”[256-cecil] was the name of [one of [these villas]1282-these villas]1281-one of these villas , “ [Albert]229-albert ”[256-cecil] of the other . These titles were not only picked out in shaded Gothic on [the garden]2301-the garden gates , but appeared a second time on the porches , where they followed the semicircular curve of the entrance arch in block capitals . “ [Albert]229-albert ”[156-sir harry] was inhabited . [[His]156-sir harry tortured garden]1284-his tortured garden was bright with geraniums and lobelias and polished shells . [His]156-sir harry little windows were chastely swathed in Nottingham lace . “ [Cissie]228-cissie villa ”[348-the ladies] was to let . Three notice - boards , belonging to [Dorking agents]1285-dorking agents , lolled on [her]129-lucy fence and announced the not surprising fact . “ [The place]390-the place is ruined ! ”[348-the ladies] said [the ladies]348-the ladies mechanically . “ [Summer Street]13-summer street will never be the same again . ”[348-the ladies]

As [the carriage]914-the carriage passed , “ [Cissie]228-cissie villa ’s ”[129-lucy] door opened , and [a gentleman]685-a gentleman came out of [her]129-lucy .

“ Stop ! ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] cried [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , touching [the coachman]1291-the coachman with [her]134-mrs. honeychurch parasol . “ Here ’s [Sir Harry]156-sir harry . Now [we]2799-we shall know . [Sir Harry]156-sir harry , pull those things down at once ! ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

[Sir Harry Otway]156-sir harry — who need not be described — came to [the carriage]914-the carriage and said “ [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , [I]156-sir harry meant to . [I]156-sir harry ca n’t , [I]156-sir harry really ca n’t turn out [Miss Flack]239-miss flack . ”[156-sir harry]

“ Am [I]156-sir harry not always right ? [She]239-miss flack ought to have gone before the contract was signed . Does [she]239-miss flack still live rent free , as [she]239-miss flack did in [[her]239-miss flack nephew]2800-her nephew ’s time ? ”[156-sir harry]

“ But what can [I]156-sir harry do ? ”[156-sir harry] [He]156-sir harry lowered [his]156-sir harry voice . “ [An old lady]599-an old lady , so very vulgar , and almost bedridden . ”[156-sir harry]

“ Turn [her]239-miss flack out , ”[256-cecil] said [Cecil]256-cecil bravely .

[Sir Harry]156-sir harry sighed , and looked at [the villas]1293-the villas mournfully . [He]156-sir harry had had full warning of [Mr. Flack]230-mr. flack ’s intentions , and might have bought [the plot]1294-the plot before building commenced : but [he]156-sir harry was apathetic and dilatory . [He]156-sir harry had known [Summer Street]13-summer street for so many years that [he]156-sir harry could not imagine [it]13-summer street being spoilt . Not till [Mrs. Flack]240-mrs. flack had laid the foundation stone , and the apparition of red and cream brick began to rise did [he]156-sir harry take alarm . [He]156-sir harry called on [Mr. Flack]230-mr. flack , [the local builder,—a most reasonable and respectful man]1295-the local builder,—a most reasonable and respectful man — who agreed that tiles would have made more artistic roof , but pointed out that slates were cheaper . [He]156-sir harry ventured to differ , however , about the Corinthian columns which were to cling like leeches to the frames of the bow windows , saying that , for [his]156-sir harry part , [he]156-sir harry liked to relieve the façade by a bit of decoration . [Sir Harry]156-sir harry hinted that a column , if possible , should be structural as well as decorative .

[Mr. Flack]230-mr. flack replied that all the columns had been ordered , adding , “ and all the capitals different — one with dragons in the foliage , another approaching to the Ionian style , another introducing [Mrs. Flack]240-mrs. flack ’s initials — every one different . ”[230-mr. flack] For [he]156-sir harry had read [his]156-sir harry [Ruskin]160-mr. ruskin . [He]156-sir harry built [[his]156-sir harry villas]1296-his villas according to [his]156-sir harry desire ; and not until [he]156-sir harry had inserted an immovable aunt into one of them did [Sir Harry]156-sir harry buy .

This futile and unprofitable transaction filled [the knight]1297-the knight with sadness as [he]1297-the knight leant on [[Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch ’s carriage]1298-mrs. honeychurch ’s carriage . [He]156-sir harry had failed in [his]156-sir harry duties to [the country - side]1299-the country - side , and [the country - side]1299-the country - side was laughing at [him]156-sir harry as well . [He]156-sir harry had spent money , and yet [Summer Street]13-summer street was spoilt as much as ever . All [he]156-sir harry could do now was to find a desirable tenant for “ [Cissie”—someone]241-cissie”—someone[156-sir harry] really desirable .

“ The rent is absurdly low , ”[156-sir harry] [he]156-sir harry told [them]1301-them , “ and perhaps [I]156-sir harry am [an easy landlord]2802-an easy landlord . But it is such an awkward size . [It]2803-it is too large for [the peasant class]2804-the peasant class and too small for [any one the least like [ourselves]2806-ourselves]2805-any one the least like ourselves . ”[156-sir harry]

[Cecil]256-cecil had been hesitating whether [he]256-cecil should despise [the villas]1293-the villas or despise [Sir Harry]156-sir harry for despising [them]1293-the villas . The latter impulse seemed the more fruitful .

“ [You]156-sir harry ought to find [a tenant]2807-a tenant at once , ”[156-sir harry] [he]156-sir harry said maliciously . “ [It]2803-it would be a perfect paradise for [a bank clerk]2808-a bank clerk . ”[156-sir harry]

“ Exactly ! ”[156-sir harry] said [Sir Harry]156-sir harry excitedly . “ That is exactly what [I]156-sir harry fear , [Mr. Vyse]219-mr. vyse . It will attract [the wrong type of people]2809-the wrong type of people . [The train]2668-the train service has improved — a fatal improvement , to [my]156-sir harry mind . “ Rather [a strenuous clerk]2812-a strenuous clerk it would be , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy .

[Cecil]256-cecil , who had [his]256-cecil full share of mediaeval mischievousness , replied that the physique of [the lower middle classes]1303-the lower middle classes was improving at a most appalling rate . [She]129-lucy saw that [he]156-sir harry was laughing at [[their]1304-their harmless neighbour]1305-their harmless neighbour , and roused [herself]129-lucy to stop [him]156-sir harry .

“ [Sir Harry]156-sir harry ! ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy exclaimed , “ [I]129-lucy have an idea . How would [you]156-sir harry like [spinsters]2813-spinsters ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [[My]129-lucy dear]2232-my dear [Lucy]129-lucy , it would be splendid . Do [you]156-sir harry know any such ? ”[129-lucy]

“ Yes ; [I]129-lucy met [them]2813-spinsters abroad . ”[129-lucy]

“ [Gentlewomen]2815-gentlewomen ? ”[156-sir harry] [he]156-sir harry asked tentatively .

“ Yes , indeed , and at the present moment homeless . [I]129-lucy heard from [them]2813-spinsters last week — [Miss Teresa]166-miss teresa and [Miss Catharine Alan]167-miss alan . [I]129-lucy ’m really not joking . [They]2813-spinsters are quite [the right people]2816-the right people . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe knows [them]2813-spinsters , too . May [I]129-lucy tell [them]2813-spinsters to write to [you]156-sir harry ? ”[129-lucy]

“ Indeed [you]129-lucy may ! ”[156-sir harry] [he]156-sir harry cried . “ Here [we]2817-we are with the difficulty solved already . How delightful it is ! [Extra facilities]2818-extra facilities — please tell [them]2813-spinsters [they]2813-spinsters shall have [extra facilities]2818-extra facilities , for [I]156-sir harry shall have [no agents]2820-no agents ’ fees . Oh , [the agents]2821-the agents ! [The appalling people [they]2821-the agents have sent [me]156-sir harry]2822-the appalling people they have sent me ! [One woman]678-one woman , when [I]156-sir harry wrote — a tactful letter , [you]2824-you know — asking [her]678-one woman to explain [her]678-one woman social position to [me]156-sir harry , replied that [she]678-one woman would pay the rent in advance . As if [one]424-one cares about that ! And several references [I]156-sir harry took up were most unsatisfactory — [people swindlers]2826-people swindlers , or not respectable . And oh , the deceit ! [I]156-sir harry have seen a good deal of the seamy side this last week . The deceit of [the most promising people]2827-the most promising people . [[My]156-sir harry dear]2232-my dear [Lucy]129-lucy , the deceit ! ”[156-sir harry]

[She]1306-she nodded .

“ [My]134-mrs. honeychurch advice , ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] put in [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , “ is to have nothing to do with [Lucy]129-lucy and [[her]129-lucy decayed gentlewomen]2829-her decayed gentlewomen at all . “ [I]156-sir harry think [I]156-sir harry follow [you]134-mrs. honeychurch , ”[156-sir harry] said [Sir Harry]156-sir harry ; “ but it is , as [you]134-mrs. honeychurch say , a very sad thing . ”[156-sir harry]

“ [The Misses Alan]242-alan are n’t that ! ”[129-lucy] cried [Lucy]129-lucy .

“ Yes , [they]2829-her decayed gentlewomen are , ”[256-cecil] said [Cecil]256-cecil . “ [I]256-cecil have n’t met [them]2829-her decayed gentlewomen but [I]256-cecil should say [they]2829-her decayed gentlewomen were a highly unsuitable addition to [the neighbourhood]2489-the neighbourhood . ”[256-cecil]

But [his]156-sir harry eye wavered when [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch exclaimed :

“ Beware ! [They]2837-they are certain to have canaries . [Sir Harry]156-sir harry , beware of [canaries]2838-canaries : [they]2838-canaries spit the seed out through the bars of [the cages]2839-the cages and then the mice come . “ Really — ”[156-sir harry] [he]156-sir harry murmured gallantly , though [he]156-sir harry saw the wisdom of [her]134-mrs. honeychurch remark .

“ [Men]2188-men do n’t gossip over tea - cups . If [they]2188-men get drunk , there ’s an end of [them]2188-men — [they]2188-men lie down comfortably and sleep it off . If [they]2188-men ’re vulgar , [they]2188-men somehow keep it to [themselves]2188-men . It does n’t spread so . [Sir Harry]156-sir harry blushed . Neither [he]156-sir harry nor [Cecil]256-cecil enjoyed these open compliments to [their]1307-their sex . [He]156-sir harry suggested that [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , if [she]134-mrs. honeychurch had time , should descend from [the carriage]914-the carriage and inspect “ [Cissie]228-cissie villa ”[156-sir harry] for [herself]134-mrs. honeychurch . [She]134-mrs. honeychurch was delighted . [Nature]244-nature had intended [her]134-mrs. honeychurch to be poor and to live in such [a house]1310-a house . Domestic arrangements always attracted [her]134-mrs. honeychurch , especially when they were on a small scale .

[Cecil]256-cecil pulled [Lucy]129-lucy back as [she]129-lucy followed [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother .

“ [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , ”[256-cecil] [he]256-cecil said , “ what if [we]1312-them two walk [home]428-home and leave [you]134-mrs. honeychurch ? ”[256-cecil]

“ Certainly ! ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] was [her]134-mrs. honeychurch cordial reply .

[Sir Harry]156-sir harry likewise seemed almost too glad to get rid of [them]1312-them . [He]156-sir harry beamed at [them]1312-them knowingly , said , “ Aha ! “ [Hopeless vulgarian]2847-hopeless vulgarian ! ”[256-cecil] exclaimed [Cecil]256-cecil , almost before [they]1312-them were out of earshot .

“ Oh , [Cecil]256-cecil ! ”[156-sir harry]

“ [He]2502-that man is n’t clever , but really [he]2502-that man is nice . ”[156-sir harry]

“ It matters supremely . [Sir Harry]156-sir harry is the essence of that garden - party . Oh , goodness , how cross [I]129-lucy feel ! This [Lucy]129-lucy was glad enough to do . If [Cecil]256-cecil disliked [Sir Harry Otway]156-sir harry and [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , what guarantee was there that [the people who really mattered to [her]129-lucy]1314-the people who really mattered to her would escape ? For instance , [Freddy]135-freddy . “ Which way shall [we]1315-we go ? ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy asked [him]256-cecil .

Nature — simplest of topics , [she]129-lucy thought — was around [them]1315-we . [Summer Street]13-summer street lay deep in [the woods]1268-the woods , and [she]129-lucy had stopped where [a footpath]1317-a footpath diverged from [the highroad]1318-the highroad .

“ Are there two ways ? ”[129-lucy]

“ Perhaps [the road]455-the road is more sensible , as [we]1315-we ’re got up smart . ”[129-lucy]
