“ Have n’t [I]129-lucy ? [The wood]2858-the wood , then , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , startled at [his]256-cecil queerness , but pretty sure that [he]256-cecil would explain later ; it was not [his]256-cecil habit to leave [her]129-lucy in doubt as to [his]256-cecil meaning .

[She]129-lucy led the way into the whispering pines , and sure enough [he]256-cecil did explain before [they]1319-they had gone a dozen yards .

“ [I]129-lucy had got an idea — [I]129-lucy dare say wrongly — that [you]129-lucy feel more at [home]428-home with [me]129-lucy in [a room]2865-a room . ”[129-lucy]

“ [A room]2865-a room ? ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy echoed , hopelessly bewildered .

“ Yes . Or , at the most , in [a garden]2867-a garden , or on [a road]2868-a road . Never in [the real country]2869-the real country like this . ”[129-lucy]

“ Oh , [Cecil]256-cecil , whatever do [you]256-cecil mean ? [I]129-lucy have never felt anything of the sort . [You]256-cecil talk as if [I]129-lucy was [a kind of poetess sort of person]2870-a kind of poetess sort of person . ”[129-lucy]

“ [I]129-lucy do n’t know that [you]256-cecil are n’t . [I]129-lucy connect [you]256-cecil with a view — a certain type of view . Why should n’t [you]256-cecil connect [me]129-lucy with [a room]2865-a room ? ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy reflected a moment , and then said , laughing :

“ Do [you]256-cecil know that [you]256-cecil ’re right ? [I]129-lucy do . [I]129-lucy must be [a poetess]2872-a poetess after all . When [I]129-lucy think of [you]256-cecil it ’s always as in [a room]2865-a room . How funny ! ”[129-lucy]

To [her]129-lucy surprise , [he]1320-he seemed annoyed .

“ [A drawing - room]2874-a drawing - room , pray ? With no view ? ”[129-lucy]

“ Yes , with no view , [I]129-lucy fancy . Why not ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [I]1320-he ’d rather , ”[1320-he] [he]1320-he said reproachfully , “ that [you]129-lucy connected [me]1320-he with the open air . ”[1320-he]

[She]129-lucy said again , “ Oh , [Cecil]256-cecil , whatever do [you]256-cecil mean ? ”[129-lucy]

As no explanation was forthcoming , [she]129-lucy shook off the subject as too difficult for [a girl]560-a girl , and led [him]1320-he further into [the wood]2858-the wood , pausing every now and then at some particularly beautiful or familiar combination of the trees . [She]129-lucy had known [the wood between [Summer Street]13-summer street and [Windy Corner]14-windy corner]1323-the wood between summer street and windy corner ever since [she]129-lucy could walk alone ; [she]129-lucy had played at losing [Freddy]135-freddy in [it]2858-the wood , when [Freddy]135-freddy was [a purple - faced baby]1324-a purple - faced baby ; and though [she]129-lucy had been to [Italy]19-italy , it had lost none of its charm .

Presently [they]1325-they came to [a little clearing among the pines]1326-a little clearing among the pines — [another tiny green alp , solitary this time , and holding in its bosom a shallow pool]1327-another tiny green alp , solitary this time , and holding in its bosom a shallow pool .

[She]129-lucy exclaimed , “ [The Sacred Lake]2875-the sacred lake ! ”[129-lucy]

“ Why do [you]135-freddy call it that ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [I]129-lucy ca n’t remember why . [I]129-lucy suppose it comes out of some book . It ’s only a puddle now , but [you]135-freddy see that stream going through it ? Well , a good deal of water comes down after heavy rains , and ca n’t get away at once , and [the pool]2876-the pool becomes quite large and beautiful . Then [Freddy]135-freddy used to bathe [there]382-there . [He]135-freddy is very fond of it . ”[129-lucy]

“ And [you]129-lucy ? ”[135-freddy]

[He]135-freddy meant , “ Are [you]129-lucy fond of it ? ”[135-freddy] But [she]129-lucy answered dreamily , “ [I]129-lucy bathed [here]2177-here , too , till [I]129-lucy was found out . Then there was a row . ”[129-lucy]

At another time [he]135-freddy might have been shocked , for [he]135-freddy had depths of prudishness within [him]135-freddy . But now ? with [his]135-freddy momentary cult of the fresh air , [he]135-freddy was delighted at [her]129-lucy admirable simplicity . [He]135-freddy looked at [her]129-lucy as [she]129-lucy stood by [the pool]2876-the pool ’s edge . [She]129-lucy was got up smart , as [she]129-lucy phrased it , and [she]129-lucy reminded [him]135-freddy of some brilliant flower that has no leaves of its own , but blooms abruptly out of a world of green .

“ Who found [you]129-lucy out ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy murmured . “ [She]129-lucy was stopping with [us]2879-us . [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett — [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett . ”[129-lucy]

“ [Poor girl]2385-poor girl ! ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy smiled gravely . A certain scheme , from which hitherto [he]135-freddy had shrunk , now appeared practical .

“ [Lucy]129-lucy ! ”[129-lucy]

“ Yes , [I]129-lucy suppose [we]2879-us ought to be going , ”[129-lucy] was [her]129-lucy reply .

“ [Lucy]129-lucy , [I]129-lucy want to ask something of [you]129-lucy that [I]129-lucy have never asked before . ”[129-lucy]

At the serious note in [his]135-freddy voice [she]129-lucy stepped frankly and kindly towards [him]135-freddy .

“ What , [Cecil]256-cecil ? ”[129-lucy]

“ Hitherto never — not even that day on [the lawn]1165-the lawn when [you]256-cecil agreed to marry [me]135-freddy — ”[135-freddy]

[He]135-freddy became self - conscious and kept glancing round to see if [they]1329-they were observed . [His]135-freddy courage had gone .

“ Yes ? ”[129-lucy]

“ Up to now [I]129-lucy have never kissed [you]135-freddy . ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy was as scarlet as if [he]135-freddy had put the thing most indelicately .

“ No — more [you]135-freddy have , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy stammered .

“ Then [I]129-lucy ask [you]135-freddy — may [I]129-lucy now ? ”[129-lucy]

“ Of course , [you]135-freddy may , [Cecil]256-cecil . [You]135-freddy might before . [I]129-lucy ca n’t run at [you]135-freddy , [you]135-freddy know . ”[129-lucy]

At that supreme moment [he]135-freddy was conscious of nothing but absurdities . [Her]129-lucy reply was inadequate . [She]129-lucy gave such a business - like lift to [her]129-lucy veil . As [he]135-freddy approached [her]129-lucy [he]135-freddy found time to wish that [he]135-freddy could recoil . As [he]135-freddy touched [her]129-lucy , [his]135-freddy gold pince - nez became dislodged and was flattened between [them]1330-them .

Such was the embrace . [He]135-freddy considered , with truth , that it had been a failure . [Passion]245-passion should believe itself irresistible . [It]245-passion should forget civility and consideration and all the other curses of a refined nature . Above all , it should never ask for leave where there is a right of way . Why could [he]135-freddy not do as [any labourer]1331-any labourer or navvy — nay , as [any young man behind the counter]1332-any young man behind the counter would have done ? [He]135-freddy recast the scene . [Lucy]129-lucy was standing flowerlike by [the water]1333-the water , [he]135-freddy rushed up and took [her]129-lucy in [his]135-freddy arms ; [she]129-lucy rebuked [him]135-freddy , permitted [him]135-freddy and revered [him]135-freddy ever after for [his]135-freddy manliness . For [he]135-freddy believed that [women]2187-women revere [men]2188-men for [their]2187-women manliness .

[They]1336-they left [the pool]2876-the pool in silence , after this one salutation . [He]135-freddy waited for [her]129-lucy to make some remark which should show [him]135-freddy [her]129-lucy inmost thoughts . At last [she]129-lucy spoke , and with fitting gravity .

“ [Emerson]126-george was the name , not [Harris]156-sir harry . ”[129-lucy]

“ What name ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [The old man]360-the old man ’s . ”[129-lucy]

“ [What old man]2883-what old man ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [That old man]2884-that old man [I]129-lucy told [you]135-freddy about . The one [Mr. Eager]169-mr. eager was so unkind to . ”[129-lucy]

[He]135-freddy could not know that this was the most intimate conversation [they]1336-they had ever had .

[Chapter X Cecil]256-cecil as [a Humourist

The society out of which [Cecil]256-cecil proposed to rescue [Lucy]129-lucy]1338-a humourist the society out of which cecil proposed to rescue lucy was perhaps no very splendid affair , yet it was more splendid than [her]129-lucy antecedents entitled [her]129-lucy to . [[Her]129-lucy father]1339-her father , [a prosperous local solicitor]1340-a prosperous local solicitor , had built [Windy Corner]14-windy corner , as a speculation at the time [the district]1341-the district was opening up , and , falling in love with [his]1339-her father own creation , had ended by living [there]382-there [himself]1339-her father . Soon after [his]1339-her father marriage the social atmosphere began to alter . [Other houses]1343-other houses were built on [the brow of [that steep southern slope]1345-that steep southern slope]1344-the brow of that steep southern slope and others , again , among the pine - trees behind , and northward on [the chalk barrier of the downs]1346-the chalk barrier of the downs . [Most of [these houses]1348-these houses]1347-most of these houses were larger than [Windy Corner]14-windy corner , and were filled by [people who came , not from [the district]1341-the district , but from [London]9-london , and who mistook [the Honeychurches]227-the honeychurches for [the remnants of [an indigenous aristocracy]1352-an indigenous aristocracy]1351-the remnants of an indigenous aristocracy]1349-people who came , not from the district , but from london , and who mistook the honeychurches for the remnants of an indigenous aristocracy . [He]1339-her father was inclined to be frightened , but [[his]1339-her father wife]2533-his wife accepted the situation without either pride or humility . “ [I]2533-his wife can not think what [people]354-people are doing , ”[2533-his wife] [she]2533-his wife would say , “ but it is extremely fortunate for [the children]2886-the children . ”[2533-his wife] [She]2533-his wife called everywhere ; [her]2533-his wife calls were returned with enthusiasm , and by the time [people]354-people found out that [she]2533-his wife was not exactly of [their]354-people milieu , [they]354-people liked [her]2533-his wife , and it did not seem to matter . When [Mr. Honeychurch]247-mr. honeychurch died , [he]1339-her father had the satisfaction — which [few honest solicitors]1355-few honest solicitors despise — of leaving [[his]1339-her father family]1356-his family rooted in the best society obtainable .

The best obtainable . Certainly [many of [the immigrants]1358-the immigrants]1357-many of the immigrants were rather dull , and [Lucy]129-lucy realized this more vividly since [her]129-lucy return from [Italy]19-italy . Hitherto [she]129-lucy had accepted [their]354-people ideals without questioning — [their]354-people kindly affluence , [their]354-people inexplosive religion , [their]354-people dislike of paper - bags , orange - peel , and broken bottles . A Radical out and out , [she]129-lucy learnt to speak with horror of [Suburbia]79-suburbia . Life , so far as [she]129-lucy troubled to conceive it , was a circle of [rich , pleasant people , with identical interests and identical foes]1359-rich , pleasant people , with identical interests and identical foes . In this circle , [one]424-one thought , married , and died . Outside it were poverty and vulgarity for ever trying to enter , just as the [London]9-london fog tries to enter [the pine - woods]888-the pine - woods pouring through the gaps in [the northern hills]1362-the northern hills . But , in [Italy]19-italy , where [any one who chooses]1363-any one who chooses may warm [himself]1363-any one who chooses in equality , as in the sun , this conception of life vanished . [Her]129-lucy senses expanded ; [she]129-lucy felt that there was [no one whom [she]129-lucy might not get to like]1364-no one whom she might not get to like , that social barriers were irremovable , doubtless , but not particularly high . [You]1365-you jump over them just as [you]1365-you jump into [[a peasant]1366-a peasant ’s olive - yard in [the Apennines]26-the apennines]1367-a peasant ’s olive - yard in the apennines , and [he]1366-a peasant is glad to see [you]1365-you . [She]129-lucy returned with new eyes .

So did [Cecil]256-cecil ; but [Italy]19-italy had quickened [Cecil]256-cecil , not to tolerance , but to irritation . [He]256-cecil saw that the local society was narrow , but , instead of saying , “ Does that very much matter ? ”[256-cecil] [he]256-cecil rebelled , and tried to substitute for it [the society [he]256-cecil called broad]1368-the society he called broad . [He]256-cecil did not realize that [Lucy]129-lucy had consecrated [her]129-lucy environment by the thousand little civilities that create a tenderness in time , and that though [her]129-lucy eyes saw its defects , [her]129-lucy heart refused to despise it entirely . Nor did [he]256-cecil realize a more important point — that if [she]129-lucy was too great for [this society]1369-this society , [she]129-lucy was too great for all society , and had reached the stage where personal intercourse would alone satisfy [her]129-lucy . [A rebel [she]129-lucy was , but not of the kind [he]256-cecil understood]1370-a rebel she was , but not of the kind he understood — [a rebel who desired , not [a wider dwelling - room]1372-a wider dwelling - room , but equality beside [the man [she]129-lucy loved]1373-the man she loved]1371-a rebel who desired , not a wider dwelling - room , but equality beside the man she loved . For [Italy]19-italy was offering [her]129-lucy the most priceless of all possessions — [her]129-lucy own soul .

Playing bumble - puppy with [Minnie Beebe]248-minnie , niece to [the rector , and aged thirteen]1374-the rector , and aged thirteen — an ancient and most honourable game , which consists in striking tennis - balls high into the air , so that they fall over the net and immoderately bounce ; some hit [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch ; others are lost . The sentence is confused , but the better illustrates [Lucy]129-lucy ’s state of mind , for [she]129-lucy was trying to talk to [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe at the same time .

“ Oh , it has been such a nuisance — first [he]256-cecil , then [they]2887-they — [no one]2230-no one knowing what [they]2887-they wanted , and [everyone]2229-everyone so tiresome . ”[129-lucy]

“ But [they]2887-they really are coming now , ”[133-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe . “ [I]133-mr. beebe wrote to [Miss Teresa]166-miss teresa a few days ago — [she]166-miss teresa was wondering how often [the butcher]2890-the butcher called , and [my]133-mr. beebe reply of once a month must have impressed [her]166-miss teresa favourably . [They]2887-they are coming . [I]133-mr. beebe heard from [them]2887-they this morning .[133-mr. beebe]

“ [I]134-mrs. honeychurch shall hate those [Miss Alans]171-the miss alans ! ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch cried . “ Just because [they]2887-they ’re [old and silly one]2891-old and silly one ’s expected to say ‘ How sweet ! ’ [I]134-mrs. honeychurch hate [their]2887-they ‘ if’-ing and ‘ but’-ing and ‘ and’-ing . And poor [Lucy]129-lucy — serve [her]129-lucy right — worn to a shadow . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

[Chapter XI In Mrs. Vyse]261-mrs. vyse ’s Well - Appointed Flat

[The Comic Muse]259-the comic muse , though able to look after [her]1421-her own interests , did not disdain the assistance of [Mr. Vyse]219-mr. vyse . [His]1416-he idea of bringing [the Emersons]164-the emersons to [Windy Corner]14-windy corner struck [her]1421-her as decidedly good , and [she]1421-her carried through the negotiations without a hitch . [Sir Harry Otway]156-sir harry signed the agreement , met [Mr. Emerson]171-the miss alans , who was duly disillusioned . [The Miss Alans]171-the miss alans were duly offended , and wrote a dignified letter to [Lucy]129-lucy , whom [they]1422-they held responsible for the failure . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe planned pleasant moments for [the new - comers]362-the new - comers , and told [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch that [Freddy]135-freddy must call on [them]362-the new - comers as soon as [they]362-the new - comers arrived . Indeed , so ample was [the Muse]259-the comic muse ’s equipment that [she]129-lucy permitted [Mr. Harris]262-mr. harris , never [a very robust criminal]1424-a very robust criminal , to droop [his]262-mr. harris head , to be forgotten , and to die .

[Lucy]129-lucy — to descend from bright heaven to earth , whereon there are shadows because there are hills — [Lucy]129-lucy was at first plunged into despair , but settled after a little thought that it did not matter the very least . Now that [she]129-lucy was engaged , [the Emersons]164-the emersons would scarcely insult [her]129-lucy and were welcome into [the neighbourhood]2489-the neighbourhood . And [Cecil]256-cecil was welcome to bring whom [he]256-cecil would into [the neighbourhood]2489-the neighbourhood . Therefore [Cecil]256-cecil was welcome to bring [the Emersons]164-the emersons into [the neighbourhood]2489-the neighbourhood . But , as [I]0-i say , this took a little thinking , and — so illogical are [girls]669-girls — the event remained rather greater and rather more dreadful than it should have done . [She]129-lucy was glad that a visit to [Mrs. Vyse]261-mrs. vyse now fell due ; [the tenants]1429-the tenants moved into [Cissie Villa]228-cissie villa while [she]129-lucy was safe in [the [London]9-london flat]1430-the london flat .

“ [Cecil]256-cecil — [Cecil]256-cecil darling , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy whispered the evening [she]129-lucy arrived , and crept into [his]256-cecil arms .

[Cecil]256-cecil , too , became demonstrative . [He]256-cecil saw that the needful fire had been kindled in [Lucy]129-lucy . At last [she]129-lucy longed for attention , as [a woman]1257-a woman should , and looked up to [him]256-cecil because [he]256-cecil was [a man]677-a man .

“ So [you]129-lucy do love [me]256-cecil , [little thing]2961-little thing ? ”[256-cecil] [he]256-cecil murmured .

“ Oh , [Cecil]256-cecil , [I]256-cecil do , [I]256-cecil do ! [I]256-cecil do n’t know what [I]256-cecil should do without [you]256-cecil . ”[256-cecil]

Several days passed . Then [she]129-lucy had a letter from [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett . A coolness had sprung up between [the two cousins]439-the two cousins , and [they]439-the two cousins had not corresponded since [they]439-the two cousins parted in August . The coolness dated from what [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett would call “ the flight to [Rome]43-rome , ”[128-miss bartlett] and in [Rome]43-rome it had increased amazingly . For [the companion who is merely uncongenial in [the mediaeval world]1435-the mediaeval world]1434-the companion who is merely uncongenial in the mediaeval world becomes exasperating in the classical . [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett , unselfish in [the Forum]1436-the forum , would have tried a sweeter temper than [Lucy]129-lucy ’s , and once , in [the Baths of [Caracalla]83-caracalla]1437-the baths of caracalla , [they]439-the two cousins had doubted whether [they]439-the two cousins could continue [their]439-the two cousins tour . [Lucy]129-lucy had said [she]129-lucy would join [the Vyses]195-the vyses — [Mrs. Vyse]261-mrs. vyse was [an acquaintance of [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother]1438-an acquaintance of her mother , so there was no impropriety in the plan and [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett had replied that [she]128-miss bartlett was quite used to being abandoned suddenly . Finally nothing happened ; but the coolness remained , and , for [Lucy]129-lucy , was even increased when [she]129-lucy opened the letter and read as follows . It had been forwarded from [Windy Corner]14-windy corner .

“ [TUNBRIDGE WELLS]11-tunbridge wells , “[263-september] [September]263-september .

“ [DEAREST LUCIA]142-lucia ,[129-lucy]

“ [I]263-september have news of [you]142-lucia at last ! [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish has been bicycling in [your]142-lucia parts , but was not sure whether a call would be welcome . [Lucy]129-lucy was much annoyed , and replied as follows :

“ [BEAUCHAMP MANSIONS]265-beauchamp mansions , S.W.[129-lucy]

“ Many thanks for [your]266-dear charlotte warning . “ [Miss Lavish]127-miss lavish can not have told [you]2974-you much about [me]267-l. m. honeychurch , for [I]267-l. m. honeychurch am not at [Windy Corner]14-windy corner at all , but here . Secrecy has this disadvantage : [we]1442-we lose the sense of proportion ; [we]1442-we can not tell whether [our]1442-we secret is important or not . Were [Lucy]129-lucy and [[her]129-lucy cousin]364-her cousin closeted with a great thing which would destroy [Cecil]256-cecil ’s life if [he]256-cecil discovered it , or with a little thing which [he]256-cecil would laugh at ? [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett suggested the former . Perhaps [she]128-miss bartlett was right . It had become a great thing now . Left to [herself]129-lucy , [Lucy]129-lucy would have told [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother and [[her]129-lucy lover]1397-her lover ingenuously , and it would have remained a little thing . “ [Emerson]171-the miss alans , not [Harris]262-mr. harris ”[129-lucy] ; it was only that a few weeks ago . [She]129-lucy tried to tell [Cecil]256-cecil even now when [they]1446-they were laughing about [some beautiful lady who had smitten [his]256-cecil heart at [school]1448-school]1447-some beautiful lady who had smitten his heart at school . But [her]129-lucy body behaved so ridiculously that [she]129-lucy stopped .

[She]129-lucy and [her]129-lucy secret stayed ten days longer in [the deserted Metropolis]1449-the deserted metropolis visiting the scenes [they]1446-they were to know so well later on . It did [her]129-lucy no harm , [Cecil]256-cecil thought , to learn the framework of society , while society itself was absent on [the golf - links]1450-the golf - links or [the moors]1451-the moors . The weather was cool , and it did [her]129-lucy no harm . In spite of the season , [Mrs. Vyse]261-mrs. vyse managed to scrape together a dinner - party consisting entirely of [the grandchildren of [famous people]1453-famous people]1452-the grandchildren of famous people . The food was poor , but the talk had a witty weariness that impressed [the girl]381-the girl . [One]424-one was tired of everything , it seemed . [One]217-one launched into enthusiasms only to collapse gracefully , and pick [oneself]217-one up amid sympathetic laughter . In this atmosphere [the Pension Bertolini]139-the pension bertolini and [Windy Corner]14-windy corner appeared equally crude , and [Lucy]129-lucy saw that [her]129-lucy [London]9-london career would estrange [her]129-lucy a little from all that [she]129-lucy had loved in the past .

[The grandchildren]1456-the grandchildren asked [her]129-lucy to play the piano .

[She]129-lucy played [Schumann]268-schumann . “ Now some [Beethoven]172-beethoven ”[129-lucy] called [Cecil]256-cecil , when the querulous beauty of the music had died . [She]129-lucy shook [her]129-lucy head and played [Schumann]268-schumann again . The melody rose , unprofitably magical . It broke ; it was resumed broken , not marching once from the cradle to the grave . The sadness of the incomplete — the sadness that is often Life , but should never be Art — throbbed in its disjected phrases , and made the nerves of [the audience]573-the audience throb . Not thus had [she]129-lucy played on the little draped piano at [the Bertolini]8-the bertolini , and “ Too much [Schumann]268-schumann ”[129-lucy] was not the remark that [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe had passed to [himself]133-mr. beebe when [she]129-lucy returned .

When [the guests]1458-the guests were gone , and [Lucy]129-lucy had gone to bed , [Mrs. Vyse]261-mrs. vyse paced up and down [the drawing - room]432-the drawing - room , discussing [her]261-mrs. vyse little party with [[her]261-mrs. vyse son]2548-her son . [Mrs. Vyse]261-mrs. vyse was [a nice woman]1461-a nice woman , but [her]261-mrs. vyse personality , like many another ’s , had been swamped by [London]9-london , for it needs a strong head to live among [many people]1462-many people . The too vast orb of [her]261-mrs. vyse fate had crushed [her]261-mrs. vyse ; and [she]261-mrs. vyse had seen too many seasons , too [many cities]1463-many cities , [too many men]1464-too many men , for [her]261-mrs. vyse abilities , and even with [Cecil]256-cecil [she]261-mrs. vyse was mechanical , and behaved as if [he]256-cecil was not [one son]1465-one son , but , so to speak , [a filial crowd]1466-a filial crowd .

“ Make [Lucy]129-lucy one of [us]2979-us , ”[261-mrs. vyse] [she]261-mrs. vyse said , looking round intelligently at the end of each sentence , and straining [her]261-mrs. vyse lips apart until [she]261-mrs. vyse spoke again . “ [Lucy]129-lucy is becoming wonderful — wonderful . ”[261-mrs. vyse]

“ [Her]129-lucy music always was wonderful . ”[261-mrs. vyse]

“ Yes , but [she]129-lucy is purging off the Honeychurch taint , most excellent Honeychurches , but [you]256-cecil know what [I]261-mrs. vyse mean . [She]129-lucy is not always quoting [servants]2980-servants , or asking one how the pudding is made . ”[261-mrs. vyse]

“ [Italy]19-italy has done it . ”[261-mrs. vyse]

“ Perhaps , ”[261-mrs. vyse] [she]261-mrs. vyse murmured , thinking of [the museum that represented [Italy]19-italy to [her]261-mrs. vyse]1467-the museum that represented italy to her . “ It is just possible . “ But [her]129-lucy music ! ”[1468-i] [he]1468-i exclaimed . “ The style of [her]129-lucy ! As [she]261-mrs. vyse was dozing off , a cry — the cry of nightmare — rang from [[Lucy]129-lucy ’s room]1470-lucy ’s room . Chapter XII Twelfth Chapter

It was a Saturday afternoon , gay and brilliant after abundant rains , and the spirit of youth dwelt in it , though the season was now autumn . All that was gracious triumphed . As [the motorcars]1476-the motorcars passed through [Summer Street]2742-summer street [they]1476-the motorcars raised only a little dust , and [their]1476-the motorcars stench was soon dispersed by the wind and replaced by the scent of the wet birches or of the pines . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , at leisure for life ’s amenities , leant over [[his]133-mr. beebe Rectory gate]1478-his rectory gate . [Freddy]135-freddy leant by [him]133-mr. beebe , smoking a pendant pipe .

“ Suppose [we]2991-we go and hinder [those new people]2992-those new people opposite for a little . ”[135-freddy]

“ M’m . ”[135-freddy]

“ [They]2992-those new people might amuse [you]133-mr. beebe . ”[135-freddy]

[Freddy]135-freddy , whom [his]133-mr. beebe fellow - creatures never amused , suggested that [the new people]1479-the new people might be feeling a bit busy , and so on , since [they]1479-the new people had only just moved in .

“ [I]133-mr. beebe suggested [we]2991-we should hinder [them]1479-the new people , ”[133-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe . “ [They]2992-those new people are worth it . ”[133-mr. beebe] Unlatching the gate , [he]133-mr. beebe sauntered over the triangular green to [Cissie Villa]228-cissie villa . “ [Hullo]254-hullo ! ”[133-mr. beebe] [he]133-mr. beebe cried , shouting in at the open door , through which much squalor was visible .

[A grave voice]1480-a grave voice replied , “ [Hullo]254-hullo ! ”[1480-a grave voice]

“ [I]1480-a grave voice ’ve brought [someone]2993-someone to see [you]135-freddy . ”[1480-a grave voice]

[The passage]1120-the passage was blocked by a wardrobe , which [the removal men had failed to carry up the stairs]1482-the removal men had failed to carry up the stairs . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe edged round [it]1483-it with difficulty . [The sitting - room itself]1484-the sitting - room itself was blocked with books .

“ [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , look at that , ”[135-freddy] said [Freddy]135-freddy in awestruck tones .

“ [I]380-the clergyman know . Is n’t it jolly ? [I]380-the clergyman like that . [I]380-the clergyman ’m certain that ’s [the old man]360-the old man ’s doing . ”[380-the clergyman]

“ Surely [you]133-mr. beebe agree ? ”[380-the clergyman]

But [Freddy]135-freddy was [[[his]135-freddy mother]1129-his mother ’s son]1487-his mother ’s son and felt that [one]424-one ought not to go on spoiling the furniture .

“ Pictures ! ”[380-the clergyman] [the clergyman]380-the clergyman continued , scrambling about [the room]373-the room . “ [Giotto]159-giotto — [they]2999-they got that at [Florence]22-florence , [I]380-the clergyman ’ll be bound . ”[380-the clergyman]

“ The same as [Lucy]129-lucy ’s got . ”[380-the clergyman]

“ [She]129-lucy came back yesterday . ”[380-the clergyman]

“ [Lucy]129-lucy used to be nearly as stupid as [I]380-the clergyman am , but it ’ll be very different now , [mother]2196-mother thinks . [She]129-lucy will read all kinds of books . ”[380-the clergyman]

[George]126-george ran down - stairs and pushed [them]1491-them into [the room]373-the room without speaking .

“ Let [me]126-george introduce [Mr. Honeychurch]247-mr. honeychurch , [a neighbour]3005-a neighbour . ”[126-george]

Then [Freddy]135-freddy hurled one of the thunderbolts of [youth]845-youth . Perhaps [he]135-freddy was shy , perhaps [he]135-freddy was friendly , or perhaps [he]135-freddy thought that [George]126-george ’s face wanted washing . “ Oh , all right , ”[126-george] said [George]126-george , impassive .

[Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe was highly entertained .

“ ‘ How d’ye do ? how [d’ye]3006-d’ye do ? Come and have a bathe , ’ ”[133-mr. beebe] [he]133-mr. beebe chuckled . “ That ’s the best conversational opening [I]133-mr. beebe ’ve ever heard . But [I]133-mr. beebe ’m afraid it will only act between [men]2188-men . “ [I]1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs tell [you]133-mr. beebe that [they]2188-men shall be , ”[1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs] said [Mr. Emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs]1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs . “ Good afternoon , [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe . “ [We]3012-we are to raise [ladies]706-ladies to [our]3012-we level ? ”[380-the clergyman] [the clergyman]380-the clergyman inquired .

“ [The Garden of Eden]3014-the garden of eden , ”[171-the miss alans] pursued [Mr. Emerson]171-the miss alans , still descending , “ which [you]133-mr. beebe place in the past , is really yet to come . [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe disclaimed placing [the Garden of Eden]3014-the garden of eden anywhere .

“ In this — not in other things — [[we]3012-we [men]2188-men]3015-we men are ahead . [We]3012-we despise the body less than [women]2187-women do . But not until [we]3012-we are [comrades]3011-comrades shall [we]3012-we enter [the garden]2301-the garden . ”[1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs]

“ [I]135-freddy say , what about this bathe ? ”[135-freddy] murmured [Freddy]135-freddy , appalled at the mass of philosophy that was approaching [him]135-freddy .

“ [I]1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs believed in a return to Nature once . But how can [we]3012-we return to [Nature]244-nature when [we]3012-we have never been with [her]244-nature ? To - day , [I]1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs believe that [we]3012-we must discover Nature . After many conquests [we]3012-we shall attain simplicity . It is [our]3012-we heritage . ”[1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs]

“ Let [me]1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs introduce [Mr. Honeychurch]247-mr. honeychurch , whose sister [you]247-mr. honeychurch will remember at [Florence]22-florence . ”[1494-mr. emerson , who had been slowly descending the stairs]

“ How do [you]247-mr. honeychurch do ? Very glad to see [you]247-mr. honeychurch , and that [you]247-mr. honeychurch are taking [George]126-george for a bathe . That evening and all that night the water ran away . On the morrow the pool had shrunk to its old size and lost its glory . Chapter XIII How [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett ’s Boiler Was So Tiresome

How often had [Lucy]129-lucy rehearsed this bow , this interview ! But [she]129-lucy had always rehearsed them indoors , and with certain accessories , which surely [we]1543-we have a right to assume . Who could foretell that [she]129-lucy and [George]126-george would meet in the rout of [a civilization]1544-a civilization , amidst an army of coats and collars and boots that lay wounded over [the sunlit earth]1545-the sunlit earth ? [She]129-lucy had imagined a young [Mr. Emerson]171-the miss alans , who might be shy or morbid or indifferent or furtively impudent . [She]129-lucy was prepared for all of these . But [she]129-lucy had never imagined [one who would be happy and greet [her]129-lucy with the shout of the morning star]1546-one who would be happy and greet her with the shout of the morning star .

Indoors [herself]129-lucy , partaking of tea with [old Mrs. Butterworth]157-mrs. butterworth , [she]129-lucy reflected that it is impossible to foretell the future with any degree of accuracy , that it is impossible to rehearse life . A fault in the scenery , a face in [the audience]573-the audience , an irruption of [the audience]573-the audience on to the stage , and all [our]1543-we carefully planned gestures mean nothing , or mean too much . “ [I]129-lucy will bow , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy had thought . “ [I]129-lucy will not shake hands with [him]256-cecil . That will be just the proper thing . ”[129-lucy] [She]129-lucy had bowed — but to whom ? To [gods]1549-gods , to [heroes]1550-heroes , to the nonsense of [school - girls]1551-school - girls ! [She]129-lucy had bowed across the rubbish that cumbers [the world]333-the world .

So ran [her]129-lucy thoughts , while [her]129-lucy faculties were busy with [Cecil]256-cecil . It was another of those dreadful engagement calls . [Mrs. Butterworth]157-mrs. butterworth had wanted to see [him]256-cecil , and [he]256-cecil did not want to be seen . When cross [he]256-cecil was always elaborate , and made long , clever answers where “ Yes ”[256-cecil] or “ No ”[256-cecil] would have done . [Lucy]129-lucy soothed [him]256-cecil and tinkered at the conversation in a way that promised well for [their]1555-their married peace . [No one]2230-no one is perfect , and surely it is wiser to discover the imperfections before wedlock . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , indeed , though not in word , had taught [the girl]381-the girl that this [our]1558-our life contains nothing satisfactory . “ [Lucy]129-lucy , ”[493-her mother] said [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother , when [they]1555-their got [home]428-home , “ is anything the matter with [Cecil]256-cecil ? ”[493-her mother]

“ Let [me]493-her mother just put [your]493-her mother bonnet away , may [I]493-her mother ? ”[493-her mother]

“ Surely [he]256-cecil could answer [her]134-mrs. honeychurch civilly for one half - hour ? ”[493-her mother]

“ [Cecil]256-cecil has a very high standard for [people]354-people , ”[129-lucy] faltered [Lucy]129-lucy , seeing trouble ahead . “ It ’s part of [his]256-cecil ideals — it is really that that makes [him]256-cecil sometimes seem — ”[129-lucy]

“ Oh , rubbish ! If high ideals make [a young man]562-a young man rude , the sooner [he]562-a young man gets rid of [them]3063-them the better , ”[134-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , handing [her]129-lucy the bonnet .

“ Now , [mother]2196-mother ! [I]493-her mother ’ve seen [you]493-her mother cross with [Mrs. Butterworth]157-mrs. butterworth [yourself]493-her mother ! ”[493-her mother]

“ Not in that way . At times [I]493-her mother could wring [her]134-mrs. honeychurch neck . But not in that way . No . It is the same with [Cecil]256-cecil all over . ”[493-her mother]

“ By - the - by — [I]493-her mother never told [you]493-her mother . [I]493-her mother had a letter from [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett while [I]493-her mother was away in [London]9-london . ”[493-her mother]

This attempt to divert the conversation was too puerile , and [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch resented it .

“ Since [Cecil]256-cecil came back from [London]9-london , nothing appears to please [him]256-cecil . Whenever [I]129-lucy speak [he]256-cecil winces;—I see [him]256-cecil , [Lucy]129-lucy ; it is useless to contradict [me]129-lucy . “ [I]493-her mother — [I]493-her mother see what [you]493-her mother mean , and certainly [Cecil]256-cecil ought n’t to . But [he]256-cecil does not mean to be uncivil — [he]256-cecil once explained — it is the things that upset [him]256-cecil — [he]256-cecil is easily upset by ugly things — [he]256-cecil is not uncivil to [people]354-people . ”[493-her mother]

“ Then why did n’t [he]256-cecil leave [the room]373-the room ? Why sit wriggling and sneering and spoiling [everyone]2229-everyone ’s pleasure ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [We]3070-we must n’t be unjust to [people]354-people , ”[129-lucy] faltered [Lucy]129-lucy . Something had enfeebled [her]129-lucy , and the case for [Cecil]256-cecil , which [she]129-lucy had mastered so perfectly in [London]9-london , would not come forth in an effective form . [The two civilizations]1563-the two civilizations had clashed — [Cecil]256-cecil hinted that [they]1563-the two civilizations might — and [she]129-lucy was dazzled and bewildered , as though the radiance that lies behind all civilization had blinded [her]129-lucy eyes . Good taste and bad taste were only catchwords , garments of diverse cut ; and music itself dissolved to a whisper through pine - trees , where the song is not distinguishable from the comic song .

[She]129-lucy remained in much embarrassment , while [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch changed [her]134-mrs. honeychurch frock for dinner ; and every now and then [she]134-mrs. honeychurch said a word , and made things no better . There was no concealing the fact , [Cecil]256-cecil had meant to be supercilious , and [he]256-cecil had succeeded . And [Lucy]129-lucy — [she]129-lucy knew not why — wished that the trouble could have come at any other time .

“ Go and dress , [dear]2190-dear ; [you]2190-dear ’ll be late . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ All right , [mother]2196-mother — ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

“ Do n’t say ‘ All right ’ and stop . Go . ”[134-mrs. honeychurch]

[She]129-lucy obeyed , but loitered disconsolately at the landing window . [It]1564-it faced north , so there was little view , and no view of the sky . But soon the conflagration died down , and the ghosts began to gather in the darkness . There were too many ghosts about . The original ghost — that touch of lips on [her]134-mrs. honeychurch cheek — had surely been laid long ago ; it could be nothing to [her]134-mrs. honeychurch that [a man]677-a man had kissed [her]134-mrs. honeychurch on [a mountain]1585-a mountain once . Alas !

“ The truth is , [dear]2190-dear , [you]256-cecil do n’t like [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett . ”[1129-his mother]

“ Hear , hear ! ”[256-cecil] said [Cecil]256-cecil .

[Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch , with more gravity than usual , and with more feeling than [she]134-mrs. honeychurch usually permitted [herself]134-mrs. honeychurch , replied : “ This is n’t very kind of [you]256-cecil two . [Cecil]256-cecil crumbled [his]256-cecil bread .

“ [I]129-lucy know , [dear]2190-dear . [She]278-cousin charlotte is kind to [everyone]2229-everyone , and yet [Lucy]129-lucy makes this difficulty when [we]3115-we try to give [her]278-cousin charlotte some little return . ”[129-lucy]

But [Lucy]129-lucy hardened [her]129-lucy heart . It was no good being kind to [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett . [She]129-lucy had tried [herself]129-lucy too often and too recently . [One]424-one might lay up treasure in heaven by the attempt , but one enriched neither [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett nor [any one else upon earth]1591-any one else upon earth . [She]129-lucy was reduced to saying : “ [I]129-lucy ca n’t help it , [mother]2196-mother . [I]129-lucy do n’t like [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett . [I]129-lucy admit it ’s horrid of [me]129-lucy . ”[129-lucy]

“ From [your]2196-mother own account , [you]2196-mother told [her]128-miss bartlett as much . ”[129-lucy]

“ Well , [she]128-miss bartlett would leave [Florence]22-florence so stupidly . [She]128-miss bartlett flurried — ”[129-lucy]

The ghosts were returning ; [they]1592-they filled [Italy]19-italy , [they]1592-they were even usurping the places [she]129-lucy had known as [a child]1084-a child . [The Sacred Lake]2875-the sacred lake would never be the same again , and , on Sunday week , something would even happen to [Windy Corner]14-windy corner . How would [she]129-lucy fight against ghosts ? For a moment the visible world faded away , and memories and emotions alone seemed real .

“ [I]256-cecil suppose [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett must come , since [she]128-miss bartlett boils eggs so well , ”[256-cecil] said [Cecil]256-cecil , who was in rather a happier frame of mind , thanks to the admirable cooking .

“ [I]135-freddy did n’t mean the egg was well boiled , ”[135-freddy] corrected [Freddy]135-freddy , “ because in point of fact [she]128-miss bartlett forgot to take it off , and as a matter of fact [I]135-freddy do n’t care for eggs . [I]135-freddy only meant how jolly kind [she]128-miss bartlett seemed . ”[135-freddy]

[Cecil]256-cecil frowned again . Oh , [these Honeychurches]1595-these honeychurches ! Eggs , boilers , hydrangeas , [maids]1596-maids — of such were [their]1595-these honeychurches lives compact . “ May [me]135-freddy and [Lucy]129-lucy get down from [our]3117-our chairs ? ”[135-freddy] [he]135-freddy asked , with scarcely veiled insolence . “ [We]3117-our do n’t want no dessert . ”[135-freddy]

Chapter XIV How [Lucy]129-lucy Faced the External Situation Bravely

Of course [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett accepted . And , equally of course , [she]128-miss bartlett felt sure that [she]128-miss bartlett would prove a nuisance , and begged to be given [an inferior spare room]1597-an inferior spare room — something with no view , anything . [Her]128-miss bartlett love to [Lucy]129-lucy . And , equally of course , [George Emerson]126-george could come to tennis on the Sunday week .

[Lucy]129-lucy faced the situation bravely , though , like most of [us]1598-us , [she]129-lucy only faced the situation that encompassed [her]129-lucy . [She]129-lucy never gazed inwards . If at times strange images rose from the depths , [she]129-lucy put them down to nerves . When [Cecil]256-cecil brought [the Emersons]164-the emersons to [Summer Street]13-summer street , it had upset [her]129-lucy nerves . [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett would burnish up past foolishness , and this might upset [her]129-lucy nerves . [She]129-lucy was nervous at night . When [she]129-lucy talked to [George]126-george — [they]1599-they met again almost immediately at [the Rectory]84-the rectory — [his]126-george voice moved [her]129-lucy deeply , and [she]129-lucy wished to remain near [him]126-george . How dreadful if [she]129-lucy really wished to remain near [him]126-george ! Of course , the wish was due to nerves , which love to play such perverse tricks upon [us]1600-us . Once [she]129-lucy had suffered from “ things that came out of nothing and meant [she]129-lucy did n’t know what . ”[256-cecil] Now [Cecil]256-cecil had explained psychology to [her]129-lucy one wet afternoon , and all the troubles of youth in [an unknown world]1601-an unknown world could be dismissed .

It is obvious enough for [the reader]1602-the reader to conclude , “ [She]129-lucy loves [young Emerson]126-george . ”[1602-the reader] [A reader in [Lucy]129-lucy ’s place]1603-a reader in lucy ’s place would not find it obvious . Life is easy to chronicle , but bewildering to practice , and [we]1600-us welcome “ nerves ”[1602-the reader] or any other shibboleth that will cloak [our]1600-us personal desire . [She]129-lucy loved [Cecil]256-cecil ; [George]126-george made [her]129-lucy nervous ; will [the reader]1602-the reader explain to [her]129-lucy that the phrases should have been reversed ?

But the external situation — [she]129-lucy will face that bravely .

The meeting at [the Rectory]2197-the rectory had passed off well enough . Standing between [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe and [Cecil]256-cecil , [she]129-lucy had made a few temperate allusions to [Italy]19-italy , and [George]126-george had replied . [She]129-lucy was anxious to show that [she]129-lucy was not shy , and was glad that [he]126-george did not seem shy either .

“ [A nice fellow]3118-a nice fellow , ”[133-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe afterwards “ [He]3118-a nice fellow will work off [his]3118-a nice fellow crudities in time . [I]133-mr. beebe rather mistrust young men who slip into life gracefully . ”[133-mr. beebe]

[Lucy]129-lucy said , “ [He]3118-a nice fellow seems in better spirits . [He]3118-a nice fellow laughs more . ”[129-lucy]

“ Yes , ”[380-the clergyman] replied [the clergyman]380-the clergyman . “ [He]3118-a nice fellow is waking up . ”[380-the clergyman]

That was all . But , as the week wore on , more of [her]129-lucy defences fell , and [she]129-lucy entertained an image that had physical beauty . In spite of the clearest directions , [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett contrived to bungle [her]129-lucy arrival . [She]129-lucy was due at [the South - Eastern station]1607-the south - eastern station at [Dorking]35-dorking , [whither Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch drove to meet [her]129-lucy . [She]129-lucy arrived at [the [London]9-london and [Brighton]90-brighton station]1608-the london and brighton station , and had to hire [a cab]905-a cab up . [No one]2230-no one was at [home]428-home except [Freddy]135-freddy and [[his]135-freddy friend]1612-his friend , who had to stop [their]1613-their tennis and to entertain [her]129-lucy for a solid hour . [Cecil]256-cecil and [Lucy]129-lucy turned up at four o’clock , and [these]1614-these , with [little Minnie Beebe]248-minnie , made a somewhat lugubrious sextette upon [the upper lawn]1615-the upper lawn for tea .

“ [I]128-miss bartlett shall never forgive [myself]128-miss bartlett , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , who kept on rising from [her]128-miss bartlett seat , and had to be begged by [the united company]1616-the united company to remain . “ [I]128-miss bartlett have upset everything . Bursting in on [young people]2228-young people ! But [I]128-miss bartlett insist on paying for [my]128-miss bartlett cab up . Grant that , at any rate . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [[Our]3120-our visitors]3121-our visitors never do such dreadful things , ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , while [[her]129-lucy brother]881-her brother , in whose memory the boiled egg had already grown unsubstantial , exclaimed in irritable tones : “ Just what [I]881-her brother ’ve been trying to convince [Cousin Charlotte]278-cousin charlotte of , [Lucy]129-lucy , for the last half hour . ”[881-her brother]

“ [I]128-miss bartlett do not feel [myself]128-miss bartlett [an ordinary visitor]3122-an ordinary visitor , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , and looked at [her]128-miss bartlett frayed glove .

“ All right , if [you]881-her brother ’d really rather . Five shillings , and [I]881-her brother gave a bob to [the driver]2281-the driver . ”[881-her brother]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett looked in [her]128-miss bartlett purse . Only sovereigns and pennies . Could [any one]397-any one give [her]128-miss bartlett change ? [Freddy]135-freddy had half a quid and [[his]135-freddy friend]1612-his friend had four half - crowns . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett accepted [their]1620-their moneys and then said : “ But who am [I]128-miss bartlett to give the sovereign to ? ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Let ’s leave it all till [mother]2196-mother comes back , ”[129-lucy] suggested [Lucy]129-lucy .

“ No , [dear]2190-dear ; [[your]2190-dear mother]2183-your mother may take quite a long drive now that [she]2183-your mother is not hampered with [me]129-lucy . [We]1620-their all have [our]1620-their little foibles , and [mine]129-lucy is the prompt settling of accounts . ”[129-lucy]

[Here [Freddy]135-freddy ’s friend]1621-here freddy ’s friend , [Mr. Floyd]277-mr. floyd , made the one remark of [his]277-mr. floyd that need be quoted : [he]277-mr. floyd offered to toss [Freddy]135-freddy for [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett ’s quid . A solution seemed in sight , and even [Cecil]256-cecil , who had been ostentatiously drinking [his]256-cecil tea at the view , felt the eternal attraction of [Chance]279-chance , and turned round .

But this did not do , either .

“ Please — please — [I]128-miss bartlett know [I]128-miss bartlett am [a sad spoil - sport]3127-a sad spoil - sport , but it would make [me]128-miss bartlett wretched . [I]128-miss bartlett should practically be robbing [the one who lost]3128-the one who lost . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [Freddy]135-freddy owes [me]256-cecil fifteen shillings , ”[256-cecil] interposed [Cecil]256-cecil . “ So it will work out right if [you]128-miss bartlett give the pound to [me]256-cecil . ”[256-cecil]

“ Fifteen shillings , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett dubiously . “ How is that , [Mr. Vyse]219-mr. vyse ? ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Because , do n’t [you]128-miss bartlett see , [Freddy]135-freddy paid [your]128-miss bartlett cab . Give [me]256-cecil the pound , and [we]3129-we shall avoid this deplorable gambling . ”[256-cecil]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , who was poor at figures , became bewildered and rendered up the sovereign , amidst the suppressed gurgles of [the other youths]1622-the other youths . For a moment [Cecil]256-cecil was happy . [He]256-cecil was playing at nonsense among [[his]256-cecil peers]1623-his peers . Then [he]256-cecil glanced at [Lucy]129-lucy , in whose face petty anxieties had marred the smiles . In [January]280-january [he]256-cecil would rescue [[his]256-cecil Leonardo]1624-his leonardo from this stupefying twaddle .

“ But [I]248-minnie do n’t see that ! ”[248-minnie] exclaimed [Minnie Beebe]248-minnie who had narrowly watched the iniquitous transaction . “ [I]248-minnie do n’t see why [Mr. Vyse]219-mr. vyse is to have the quid . ”[248-minnie]

“ Because of the fifteen shillings and the five , ”[1625-they] [they]1625-they said solemnly . “ Fifteen shillings and five shillings make one pound , [you]219-mr. vyse see . ”[1625-they]

“ But [I]248-minnie do n’t see — ”[248-minnie]

[They]1625-they tried to stifle [her]129-lucy with cake .

“ No , thank [you]219-mr. vyse . [I]248-minnie ’m done . [I]248-minnie do n’t see why — [Freddy]135-freddy , do n’t poke [me]248-minnie . “ [I]128-miss bartlett had forgotten [the driver]2281-the driver , ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , reddening . “ Thank [you]219-mr. vyse , [dear]2190-dear , for reminding [me]128-miss bartlett . “ [I]1626-the young hostess ’ll get it , ”[1626-the young hostess] said [the young hostess]1626-the young hostess , rising with decision .

“ [Cecil]256-cecil , give [me]128-miss bartlett that sovereign . No , give [me]128-miss bartlett up that sovereign . [I]128-miss bartlett ’ll get [Euphemia]233-euphemia to change it , and [we]1628-we ’ll start the whole thing again from the beginning . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [Lucy]129-lucy — [Lucy]129-lucy — what a nuisance [I]128-miss bartlett am ! ”[128-miss bartlett] protested [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , and followed [her]1626-the young hostess across [the lawn]1165-the lawn . [Lucy]129-lucy tripped ahead , simulating hilarity . When [they]1628-we were out of earshot [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett stopped [her]128-miss bartlett wails and said quite briskly : “ Have [you]129-lucy told [him]364-her cousin about [him]364-her cousin yet ? ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ No , [I]129-lucy have n’t , ”[129-lucy] replied [Lucy]129-lucy , and then could have bitten [her]129-lucy tongue for understanding so quickly what [[her]129-lucy cousin]364-her cousin meant . “ Let [me]129-lucy see — a sovereign ’s worth of silver . ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy escaped into [the kitchen]1630-the kitchen . [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett ’s sudden transitions were too uncanny . It sometimes seemed as if [she]128-miss bartlett planned every word [she]128-miss bartlett spoke or caused to be spoken ; as if all this worry about cabs and change had been a ruse to surprise [the soul]1631-the soul .

“ No , [I]128-miss bartlett have n’t told [Cecil]256-cecil or [any one]397-any one , ”[128-miss bartlett] [she]128-miss bartlett remarked , when [she]128-miss bartlett returned . “ [I]128-miss bartlett promised [you]256-cecil [I]128-miss bartlett should n’t . Here is [your]256-cecil money — all shillings , except two half - crowns . Would [you]256-cecil count it ? [You]256-cecil can settle [your]256-cecil debt nicely now . ”[128-miss bartlett]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett was in [the drawing - room]432-the drawing - room , gazing at the photograph of [St. John ascending]165-st. john , which had been framed .

“ How dreadful ! ”[128-miss bartlett] [she]128-miss bartlett murmured , “ how more than dreadful , if [Mr. Vyse]219-mr. vyse should come to hear of it from some other source . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Oh , no , [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett , ”[381-the girl] said [the girl]381-the girl , entering the battle . “ [George Emerson]126-george is all right , and what other source is there ? ”[381-the girl]

[Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett considered . “ For instance , [the driver]2281-the driver . [I]128-miss bartlett saw [him]2281-the driver looking through the bushes at [you]129-lucy , remember [he]2281-the driver had a violet between [his]2281-the driver teeth . ”[128-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]129-lucy shuddered a little . “ [We]3138-we shall get the silly affair on [our]3138-we nerves if [we]3138-we are n’t careful . How could [a Florentine cab - driver]3139-a florentine cab - driver ever get hold of [Cecil]256-cecil ? ”[129-lucy]

“ [We]3138-we must think of every possibility . ”[381-the girl]

“ Oh , it ’s all right . ”[129-lucy]

“ Or perhaps [old Mr. Emerson]126-george knows . In fact , [he]126-george is certain to know . ”[381-the girl]

“ [I]129-lucy do n’t care if [he]126-george does . [I]129-lucy was grateful to [you]129-lucy for [your]129-lucy letter , but even if the news does get round , [I]129-lucy think [I]129-lucy can trust [Cecil]256-cecil to laugh at it . ”[129-lucy]

“ To contradict it ? ”[381-the girl]

“ No , to laugh at it . ”[129-lucy] But [she]129-lucy knew in [her]129-lucy heart that [she]129-lucy could not trust [him]1634-him , for [he]1634-him desired [her]129-lucy untouched .

“ Very well , [dear]2190-dear , [you]129-lucy know best . Perhaps [gentlemen]2260-gentlemen are different to what [they]2260-gentlemen were when [I]381-the girl was young . [Ladies]706-ladies are certainly different . ”[381-the girl]

“ Now , [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett ! ”[129-lucy] [She]129-lucy struck at [her]129-lucy playfully . “ [You]128-miss bartlett kind , anxious thing . What would [you]129-lucy have [me]129-lucy do ? [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett sighed “ [I]128-miss bartlett am no match for [you]129-lucy in conversation , [dearest]2630-dearest . [You]129-lucy will never forgive [me]128-miss bartlett . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Shall [we]3144-we go out , then . [They]3145-they will smash all the china if [we]3144-we do n’t . ”[381-the girl]

For the air rang with the shrieks of [Minnie]248-minnie , who was being scalped with a teaspoon .

“ [Dear]2190-dear , one moment — [we]3144-we may not have this chance for a chat again . Have [you]129-lucy seen [the young one]3147-the young one yet ? ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Yes , [I]128-miss bartlett have . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ What happened ? ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ [We]3144-we met at [the Rectory]84-the rectory . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ What line is [he]3147-the young one taking up ? ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ No line . [He]3147-the young one talked about [Italy]19-italy , like [any other person]3148-any other person . It is really all right . What advantage would [he]3147-the young one get from being [a cad]3149-a cad , to put it bluntly ? [I]128-miss bartlett do wish [I]128-miss bartlett could make [you]129-lucy see it [my]128-miss bartlett way . [He]3147-the young one really wo n’t be any nuisance , [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Once [a cad]3149-a cad , always [a cad]3149-a cad . That is [my]128-miss bartlett poor opinion . ”[128-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]129-lucy paused . “ [Cecil]256-cecil said one day — and [I]129-lucy thought it so profound — that there are two kinds of cads — [the conscious and the subconscious]3152-the conscious and the subconscious . ”[129-lucy] [She]129-lucy paused again , to be sure of doing justice to [Cecil]256-cecil ’s profundity . Through the window [she]129-lucy saw [Cecil]256-cecil [himself]256-cecil , turning over the pages of a novel . It was a new one from [[Smith]281-smith ’s library]1635-smith ’s library . [[Her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother must have returned from [the station]1637-the station .

“ Once [a cad]3149-a cad , always [a cad]3149-a cad , ”[128-miss bartlett] droned [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett .

“ What [I]1638-i mean by subconscious is that [Emerson]126-george lost [his]126-george head . [I]1638-i fell into all those violets , and [he]126-george was silly and surprised . [I]1638-i do n’t think [we]3155-we ought to blame [him]126-george very much . It makes such a difference when [you]3156-you see [a person with beautiful things behind [him]3157-a person with beautiful things behind him unexpectedly unexpectedly]3157-a person with beautiful things behind him unexpectedly . It really does ; it makes an enormous difference , and [he]126-george lost [his]126-george head : [he]126-george does n’t admire [me]1638-i , or any of that nonsense , one straw . [Freddy]135-freddy rather likes [him]126-george , and has asked [him]126-george up here on Sunday , so [you]3156-you can judge for [yourself]3156-you . [He]126-george has improved ; [he]126-george does n’t always look as if [he]126-george ’s going to burst into tears . [He]126-george is a clerk in [[the General Manager]3158-the general manager ’s office at [one of [the big railways]3161-the big railways]3160-one of the big railways]3159-the general manager ’s office at one of the big railways — not [a porter]2604-a porter ! and runs down to [[his]126-george father]395-his father for week - ends . [Papa]282-papa was to do with journalism , but is rheumatic and has retired . [There]382-there ! Now for [the garden]2301-the garden . ”[1638-i] [She]1638-i took hold of [[her]1638-i guest]1639-her guest by the arm . “ Suppose [we]3166-we do n’t talk about this silly Italian business any more . [We]3166-we want [you]1639-her guest to have a nice restful visit at [Windy Corner]14-windy corner , with no worriting . ”[1638-i]

[Lucy]129-lucy thought this rather a good speech . [The reader]1602-the reader may have detected an unfortunate slip in it . Whether [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett detected the slip one can not say , for it is impossible to penetrate into the minds of [elderly people]1641-elderly people . [She]128-miss bartlett might have spoken further , but [they]1642-they were interrupted by the entrance of [[her]128-miss bartlett hostess]1643-her hostess . Explanations took place , and in the midst of [them]1642-they [Lucy]129-lucy escaped , the images throbbing a little more vividly in [her]129-lucy brain .

Chapter XV The Disaster Within

The Sunday after [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett ’s arrival was a glorious day , like most of the days of that year . In [the Weald]36-the weald , autumn approached , breaking up the green monotony of summer , touching [the parks]1644-the parks with the grey bloom of mist , the beech - trees with russet , the oak - trees with gold . Up on [the heights]1645-the heights , battalions of black pines witnessed the change , [themselves]1646-themselves unchangeable . [Either country]1647-either country was spanned by a cloudless sky , and in either arose the tinkle of church bells .

[The garden of [Windy Corners]91-windy corners]1648-the garden of windy corners was deserted except for a red book , which lay sunning itself upon [the gravel path]1649-the gravel path . From [the house]928-the house came incoherent sounds , as of [females preparing for worship]1651-females preparing for worship . “ [The men]1578-the men say [they]1578-the men wo n’t go”—“Well[0-i] , [I]0-i do n’t blame them”—Minnie says , “[1652-she] need [she]1652-she go?”—“Tell [her]1652-she , no nonsense”—“Anne[232-mary] ! [Mary]232-mary ! Hook [me]0-i behind!”—“Dearest [Lucia]142-lucia , may [I]0-i trespass upon [you]142-lucia for a pin ? ”[0-i] For [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett had announced that [she]128-miss bartlett at all events was one for [church]571-church .

The sun rose higher on its journey , guided , not by [Phaethon]200-phaethon , but by [Apollo]283-apollo , competent , unswerving , divine . Its rays fell on [the ladies]348-the ladies whenever [they]348-the ladies advanced towards the bedroom windows ; on [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe down at [Summer Street]13-summer street as [he]133-mr. beebe smiled over a letter from [Miss Catharine Alan]167-miss alan ; on [George Emerson]126-george cleaning [[his]126-george father]395-his father ’s boots ; and lastly , to complete the catalogue of memorable things , on the red book mentioned previously . [The ladies]348-the ladies move , [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe moves , [George]126-george moves , and movement may engender shadow . But this book lies motionless , to be caressed all the morning by the sun and to raise its covers slightly , as though acknowledging the caress .

Presently [Lucy]129-lucy steps out of [the drawing - room]432-the drawing - room window . [Her]129-lucy new cerise dress has been a failure , and makes [her]129-lucy look tawdry and wan . At [her]129-lucy throat is a garnet brooch , on [her]129-lucy finger a ring set with rubies — an engagement ring . [Her]129-lucy eyes are bent to the Weald . [She]129-lucy frowns a little — not in anger , but as [a brave child]1658-a brave child frowns when [he]1658-a brave child is trying not to cry . In all that expanse no human eye is looking at [her]129-lucy , and [she]129-lucy may frown unrebuked and measure the spaces that yet survive between [Apollo]283-apollo and [the western hills]1659-the western hills .

“ [Lucy]129-lucy ! [Lucy]129-lucy ! What ’s that book ? Who ’s been taking a book out of the shelf and leaving it about to spoil ? ”[129-lucy]

“ It ’s only the library book that [Cecil]256-cecil ’s been reading . ”[129-lucy]

“ But pick it up , and do n’t stand idling there like a flamingo . ”[129-lucy]

[Lucy]129-lucy picked up the book and glanced at the title listlessly , Under [a Loggia]1660-a loggia . [She]129-lucy no longer read novels [herself]129-lucy , devoting all [her]129-lucy spare time to solid literature in the hope of catching [Cecil]256-cecil up . It was dreadful how little [she]129-lucy knew , and even when [she]129-lucy thought [she]129-lucy knew a thing , like [the Italian painters]1661-the italian painters , [she]129-lucy found [she]129-lucy had forgotten it . Only this morning [she]129-lucy had confused [Francesco Francia]284-francesco francia with [Piero della Francesca]285-piero della francesca , and [Cecil]256-cecil had said , “ What ! [you]129-lucy are n’t forgetting [[your]129-lucy [Italy]19-italy]3168-your italy already ? ”[256-cecil] And this too had lent anxiety to [her]129-lucy eyes when [she]129-lucy saluted the dear view and [the dear garden]1662-the dear garden in the foreground , and above them , scarcely conceivable elsewhere , the dear sun .

“ [Lucy]129-lucy — have [you]129-lucy a sixpence for [Minnie]248-minnie and a shilling for [yourself]129-lucy ? ”[129-lucy]

[She]129-lucy hastened in to [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother , who was rapidly working [herself]493-her mother into [a Sunday fluster]1664-a sunday fluster .

“ It ’s a special collection — [I]493-her mother forget what for . [I]493-her mother do beg , no vulgar clinking in the plate with halfpennies ; see that [Minnie]248-minnie has a nice bright sixpence . Where is [the child]545-the child ? [Minnie]248-minnie ! That book ’s all warped . ( [Gracious]286-gracious , how plain [you]129-lucy look ! ) Put it under the Atlas to press . [Minnie]248-minnie ! ”[493-her mother]

“ Oh , [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch — ”[1668-the rector ’s niece] from [the upper regions]1665-the upper regions .

“ [Minnie]248-minnie , do n’t be late . Here comes [the horse”—it]3170-the horse”—it[493-her mother] was always the horse , never [the carriage]914-the carriage . “ Where ’s [Charlotte]128-miss bartlett ? Run up and hurry [her]128-miss bartlett . Why is [she]128-miss bartlett so long ? [She]128-miss bartlett had nothing to do . [She]128-miss bartlett never brings anything but blouses . [Poor Charlotte]128-miss bartlett — How [I]493-her mother do detest blouses ! [Minnie]248-minnie ! ”[493-her mother]

Paganism is infectious — more infectious than diphtheria or piety — and [[the Rector]1667-the rector ’s niece]1668-the rector ’s niece was taken to [church]571-church protesting . As usual , [she]1668-the rector ’s niece did n’t see why . Why should n’t [she]1668-the rector ’s niece sit in the sun with [the young men]1670-the young men ? [The young men]1670-the young men , who had now appeared , mocked [her]1668-the rector ’s niece with ungenerous words . [Mrs. Honeychurch]134-mrs. honeychurch defended orthodoxy , and in the midst of the confusion [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , dressed in the very height of the fashion , came strolling down [the stairs]1672-the stairs .

“ [Dear Marian]232-mary , [I]128-miss bartlett am very sorry , but [I]128-miss bartlett have no small change — nothing but sovereigns and half crowns . Could [any one]397-any one give [me]128-miss bartlett — ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ Yes , easily . Jump in . Gracious [me]128-miss bartlett , how smart [you]232-mary look ! What a lovely frock ! [You]232-mary put [us]1674-they all to shame . ”[128-miss bartlett]

“ If [I]128-miss bartlett did not wear [my]128-miss bartlett best rags and tatters now , when should [I]128-miss bartlett wear them ? ”[128-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett reproachfully . [She]128-miss bartlett got into [the victoria]1263-the victoria and placed [herself]128-miss bartlett with [her]128-miss bartlett back to the horse . The necessary roar ensued , and then [they]1674-they drove off .

“ Good - bye ! Be good ! ”[256-cecil] called out [Cecil]256-cecil .

[Lucy]129-lucy bit [her]129-lucy lip , for the tone was sneering . On the subject of “ church and so on ”[256-cecil] [they]1674-they had had rather an unsatisfactory conversation . [He]256-cecil had said that [people]354-people ought to overhaul [themselves]354-people , and [she]129-lucy did not want to overhaul [herself]129-lucy ; [she]129-lucy did not know it was done . [Honest orthodoxy]287-honest orthodoxy [Cecil]256-cecil respected , but [he]256-cecil always assumed that honesty is the result of a spiritual crisis ; [he]256-cecil could not imagine it as a natural birthright , that might grow heavenward like flowers . All that [he]256-cecil said on this subject pained [her]129-lucy , though [he]256-cecil exuded tolerance from every pore ; somehow [the Emersons]164-the emersons were different .

[She]129-lucy saw [the Emersons]164-the emersons after [church]571-church . There was a line of [carriages]1677-carriages down [the road]455-the road , and [the Honeychurch vehicle]1679-the honeychurch vehicle happened to be opposite [Cissie Villa]228-cissie villa . To save time , [they]1680-they walked over [the green]1681-the green to [it]228-cissie villa , and found [father]2750-father and [son]1683-son smoking in [the garden]2301-the garden .

“ Introduce [me]493-her mother , ”[493-her mother] said [[her]129-lucy mother]493-her mother . “ Unless [the young man]393-the young man considers that [he]393-the young man knows [me]493-her mother already . ”[493-her mother]

[He]2750-father probably did ; but [Lucy]129-lucy ignored [the Sacred Lake]288-the sacred lake and introduced [them]1680-they formally . [Old Mr. Emerson]289-old mr. emerson claimed [her]129-lucy with much warmth , and said how glad [he]289-old mr. emerson was that [she]129-lucy was going to be married . [She]129-lucy said yes , [she]129-lucy was glad too ; and then , as [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett and [Minnie]248-minnie were lingering behind with [Mr. Beebe]133-mr. beebe , [she]129-lucy turned the conversation to a less disturbing topic , and asked [him]2750-father how [he]2750-father liked [[his]2750-father new house]1686-his new house .

[Cecil]256-cecil , this afternoon seemed such [a twittering sparrow]1753-a twittering sparrow . The ups and downs in [his]126-george voice were noticeable , but they did not affect [her]129-lucy . [She]129-lucy had dwelt amongst melody and movement , and [her]129-lucy nerves refused to answer to the clang of [his]126-george . “ How do [you]126-george like this view of [ours]3214-us , [Mr. Emerson]126-george ? ”[126-george]

“ [I]126-george never notice much difference in views . ”[126-george]

“ What do [you]126-george mean ? ”[126-george]

“ Because [they]3215-they ’re all alike . Because all that matters in [them]3215-they is distance and air . ”[126-george]

“ H’m ! ”[256-cecil] said [Cecil]256-cecil , uncertain whether the remark was striking or not .

Chapter XVI Lying to [George]126-george

But [Lucy]129-lucy had developed since the spring . That is to say , [she]129-lucy was now better able to stifle the emotions of which the conventions and [the world]333-the world disapprove . Then [she]129-lucy prepared for action . Love felt and returned , love which [our]1765-our bodies exact and [our]1765-our hearts have transfigured , love which is the most real thing that [we]1765-our shall ever meet , reappeared now as [the world]333-the world ’s enemy , and [she]129-lucy must stifle it .

[She]129-lucy sent for [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett .

The contest lay not between love and duty . Perhaps there never is such a contest . It lay between the real and [the pretended]1767-the pretended , and [Lucy]129-lucy ’s first aim was to defeat [herself]129-lucy . As [her]129-lucy brain clouded over , as the memory of the views grew dim and the words of the book died away , [she]129-lucy returned to [her]129-lucy old shibboleth of nerves . [She]129-lucy “ conquered [her]129-lucy breakdown . ”[129-lucy] Tampering with the truth , [she]129-lucy forgot that the truth had ever been . “ No , but have [you]128-miss bartlett ever ? Then [he]256-cecil brings [us]3299-us here , and [we]3299-us find it is to play some silly trick on [a kind neighbour]3300-a kind neighbour . That is [the man]2468-the man all over — playing tricks on [people]354-people , on the most sacred form of life that [he]256-cecil can find . Next , [I]1792-i meet [you]3303-you together , and find [him]256-cecil protecting and teaching [you]3303-you and [[your]3303-you mother]2183-your mother to be shocked , when it was for [you]3303-you to settle whether [you]3303-you were shocked or no . [Cecil]256-cecil all over again . [He]256-cecil dare n’t let [a woman]1257-a woman decide . [He]256-cecil ’s [the type who ’s kept [Europe]49-europe back for a thousand years]3306-the type who ’s kept europe back for a thousand years . Every moment of [his]256-cecil life [he]256-cecil ’s forming [you]3303-you , telling [you]3303-you what ’s charming or amusing or ladylike , telling [you]3303-you what [a man]677-a man thinks womanly ; and [you]3303-you , [[you]3303-you of [all women]3309-all women]3308-you of all women , listen to [his]256-cecil voice instead of to [your]3303-you own . So it was at [the Rectory]84-the rectory , when [I]1792-i met [you]3303-you both again ; so it has been the whole of this afternoon . Therefore — not ‘ therefore [I]1792-i kissed [you]3303-you , ’ because the book made [me]1792-i do that , and [I]1792-i wish to goodness [I]1792-i had more self - control . [I]1792-i ’m not ashamed . [I]1792-i do n’t apologize . But it has frightened [you]3303-you , and [you]3303-you may not have noticed that [I]1792-i love [you]3303-you . Or would [you]3303-you have told [me]1792-i to go , and dealt with a tremendous thing so lightly ? But therefore — therefore [I]1792-i settled to fight [him]1793-i . ”[1792-i]

[Lucy]129-lucy thought of a very good remark .

“ [You]3303-you say [Mr. Vyse]219-mr. vyse wants [me]1793-i to listen to [him]1793-i , [Mr. Emerson]126-george . Pardon [me]1793-i for suggesting that [you]3303-you have caught the habit . ”[1793-i]

And [he]1793-i took the shoddy reproof and touched it into immortality . [He]1793-i said :

“ Yes , [I]1793-i have , ”[1793-i] and sank down as if suddenly weary . “ [I]1793-i ’m [the same kind of brute]3310-the same kind of brute at bottom . This desire to govern [a woman]1257-a woman — it lies very deep , and [men]2188-men and [women]2187-women must fight it together before [they]3314-they shall enter [the garden]2301-the garden . But [I]1793-i do love [you]3303-you surely in a better way than [he]1793-i does . ”[1793-i] [He]1793-i thought . “ Yes — really in a better way . [I]1793-i want [you]3303-you to have [your]3303-you own thoughts even when [I]1793-i hold [you]3303-you in [my]1793-i arms . ”[1793-i] [He]1793-i stretched [them]1794-them towards [her]1795-her . “ [Lucy]129-lucy , be quick — there ’s no time for [us]3316-us to talk now — come to [me]1793-i as [you]3303-you came in the spring , and afterwards [I]1793-i will be gentle and explain . [I]1793-i have cared for [you]3303-you since [that man]2502-that man died . [I]1793-i can not live without [you]3303-you , ‘ No good , ’ [I]1793-i thought ; ‘ [she]1795-her is marrying [someone else]3318-someone else ’ ; but [I]1793-i meet [you]3303-you again when [all the world]3319-all the world is glorious water and sun . As [you]3303-you came through [the wood]2858-the wood [I]1793-i saw that nothing else mattered . [I]1793-i called . [I]1793-i wanted to live and have [my]1793-i chance of joy . ”[1793-i]

“ And [Mr. Vyse]219-mr. vyse ? ”[129-lucy] said [Lucy]129-lucy , who kept commendably calm . “ Does [he]1796-he not matter ? That [I]129-lucy love [Cecil]256-cecil and shall be [[his]1796-he wife]2533-his wife shortly ? A detail of no importance , [I]129-lucy suppose ? ”[129-lucy]

But [he]1796-he stretched [his]1796-he arms over the table towards [her]129-lucy .

“ May [I]1796-he ask what [you]129-lucy intend to gain by this exhibition ? ”[1796-he]

[He]1796-he said : “ It is [our]3322-our last chance . [I]1796-he shall do all that [I]1796-he can . ”[1796-he] And as if [he]1796-he had done all else , [he]1796-he turned to [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , who sat like [some portent against the skies of the evening]1797-some portent against the skies of the evening . “ [You]128-miss bartlett would n’t stop [us]3322-our this second time if [you]128-miss bartlett understood , ”[1796-he] [he]1796-he said . “ [I]1796-he have been into the dark , and [I]1796-he am going back into it , unless [you]128-miss bartlett will try to understand . ”[1796-he]

[Her]128-miss bartlett long , narrow head drove backwards and forwards , as though demolishing some invisible obstacle . [She]128-miss bartlett did not answer .

“ It is being young , ”[1796-he] [he]1796-he said quietly , picking up [his]1796-he racquet from the floor and preparing to go . “ It is being certain that [Lucy]129-lucy cares for [me]1796-he really . It is that love and youth matter intellectually . ”[1796-he]

In silence [the two women]1798-the two women watched [him]1796-he . [His]1796-he last remark , [they]1798-the two women knew , was nonsense , but was [he]1796-he going after it or not ? Would not [he]1796-he , [the cad]1781-the cad , [the charlatan]1800-the charlatan , attempt a more dramatic finish ? No . [He]1796-he was apparently content . [He]1796-he left [them]1798-the two women , carefully closing the front door ; and when [they]1798-the two women looked through the hall window , [they]1798-the two women saw [him]1796-he go up [the drive]1801-the drive and begin to climb [the slopes of withered fern behind [the house]928-the house]1802-the slopes of withered fern behind the house . [Their]1798-the two women tongues were loosed , and [they]1798-the two women burst into stealthy rejoicings .

“ Oh , [Lucia]142-lucia — come back here — oh , what [an awful man]3323-an awful man ! ”[1798-the two women]

[Lucy]129-lucy had no reaction — at least , not yet . “ Well , [he]1796-he amuses [me]129-lucy , ”[129-lucy] [she]129-lucy said . “ Either [I]129-lucy ’m mad , or else [he]1796-he is , and [I]129-lucy ’m inclined to think it ’s the latter . [[My]129-lucy admirer]3325-my admirer will hardly trouble [me]129-lucy again . ”[129-lucy]

And [Miss Bartlett]128-miss bartlett , too , essayed the roguish :
